loans.name: Mathias

texts.fr: Mathias M. est cultivateur et aide mécanicien, et il est client d’ACB depuis 2007.  Il est né a Rwanda, il est marié, et il a 50 ans.  Il a 12 enfants entre 1 an et 21 ans, et 8 de ses enfants vont à l’école.  Il va utiliser son prêt pour l’achat d’une vache.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance d’affaire est d’acheter des autres vaches pour avoir une ferme.  Ses ambitions pour sa famille est de construire une maison d’habitation pour la famille.
texts.en: Mathias M. is a farmer and assistant mechanic. He has been a client of the microfinance institution Amasezerano Community Banking S.A. since 2007. He was born in Rwanda, is married and is 50 years old. He has 12 children aged between 1 and 21, and 8 of his children attend school. He will use his loan to buy a cow. His strategy for the growth of his business consists in buying more cows and finally owning a farm. His ambition is to build a house for his family.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena R. is from the village of Opol, Misamis Oriental. She is 38 years old. Rowena is married and has one school-aged children. To make a living, Rowena owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from making and selling snacks and other delicacies like rice and cheese cakes in the local community. Rowena has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Rowena joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rowena is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Rowena from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa L. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 50 years old. Rosa is married. To make a living, Rosa owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Rosa currently earns approximately 4500 PHP from farming.

Rosa joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosa has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Rosa is requesting a new loan of 17000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia, 45, is a farmer from the town of Nyamira in western Kenya. She is married and has been blessed with 5 children, who are now all adults. She has been in the farming business for 20 years and sells her products locally. She is also employed as a teacher in the same location.

Teresia has requested a loan of 45,000 KES through Kiva's partner, Juhudi Kilimo, to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The profits from this loan will help her improve her family's livelihood. She hopes to acquire 5 more dairy cows in the next 5 years, which will improve her milk production.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Mr. Oem Uon Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of nineteen people, who have selected Mr. Oem U. as village bank president. All members of this group, located in Kandal village in Takeo province, will use their portions of the loan to improve their family's lives.

Mr. Oem U. sells brooms door-to-door, earning some profit to support his family. His wife, Mrs. Mao Som, is a farmer who owns a very small piece of land, growing rice to sell to support her family. She is also a rice wine maker. Mr. Oem U. wants to start a new business breeding pigs, but doesn't have enough money to do so. Therefore, he is asking for a loan to buy some piglets and more rice to make rice wine. Mr. Oem U. is the father of two children; one is employed in a garment factory and the other is a waiter.

loans.use: to buy some piglets

loans.name: Eulogia

texts.en:
Eulogia B. is from the village of Upper Carmen, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 41 years old. Eulogia is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Eulogia owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from dealing and selling clothing, cosmetics and shoe products from NATASHA & AVON in the local community. Eulogia has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Eulogia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eulogia is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like cosmetics and blouses. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Eulogia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like cosmetics and blouses

location.town: Upper Carmen, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Mar

texts.en:
Mar M. is from the town of PINES,Oroquieta City. He is 32 years old. Mar is married. To make a living, Mar owns and operates a business venture in the services sector operating a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing repair services to local community members. Mar has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Mar joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mar has successfully repaid a previous loan of 70000 PHP from GDMPC. Mar is requesting a new loan of 40000 PHP which will be used to purchase new equipment and tools to expand the business. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Mar from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new equipment and tools to expand the business

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex N. is from the village of Mother Ignacia Village, Cagayan de Oro City. He is 23 years old. Alex is single. To make a living, Alex owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, junk foods and toothpaste in the local community. Alex has been engaged in his business for over one year and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Alex joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alex is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like junk foods. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Alex from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like junk foods

location.town: Mother Ignacia Village, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Or

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa S. is from the village of Upper Carmen, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 39 years old. Elsa is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Elsa owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling seafood products  including dried fish and squid in the local community. Elsa has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Elsa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elsa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Elsa is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like dried fish and squid. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Elsa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like dried fish and squid

location.town: Upper Carmen, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Vanessa

texts.en:
Vanessa V. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 31 years old. Vanessa is married and has three children aged 9, 5 and 2. She is engaged in farming. She plants and harvests rice crops. Her husband, who is also a farmer, earns extra through "habal-habal" (motorcycle transportation). Vanessa dreams for her children to finish their studies and have bright futures.

Vanessa joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vanessa has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Vanessa is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: She wants to buy materials for her business

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla, 53, is a married mother of three children who are between the ages of two months and eight years. Two of the children attend school. She has been practicing mixed farming for the last six years, producing bananas, tea, maize and beans, all of which are sold locally. Her biggest challenge in this business has been a lack of enough funds to improve her farming activities.

Priscilla is requesting a loan of 30,000 KES through Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income arising from this loan will help her pay school fees for her children and improve the family's livelihood. She plans to expand her business in the future by increasing the number of her dairy cows to three.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a  45-year-old married man living in Nabatieh with his wife and 6 children. Hussein owns a shop where he has been selling chickens since 2005.  He has 11 years of experience in this field. Hussein works hard to improve his business because it's his only source of income.

Hussein is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to buy a bigger generator for his shop, since the electricity problem is becoming more  complicated day by day in the region. Hussein's clients are most of his neighbors, relatives and friends.  They state that his quality of products is better than competitors in the region. 

Hussein hopes to open a farm of his own where he can raise his own chickens to trade with.

loans.use: To buy a bigger generator for shop

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: expending her business

loans.name: Mrs. Lay Sok Ny Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of twelve people located in Kandal village in Takeo province. The members of this group have selected Mrs. Lay S. N. as the village bank president for this loan.  The members will use their portion of the loan in various ways to improve their family living. 

Mrs. Lay S. N. is a farmer who owns a half-hectare plot of land where she cultivates rice to sell to support her family.  Her husband, Mr. Nou Yean, is a door-to-door broom seller, earning some profits to support the family. Currently, Mrs. Lay S. N. has a problem because her husband needs a motorbike for transportation to sell brooms.  To improve this condition, Mrs. Lay S. N. is requesting a loan to buy a new motorbike. 

Mrs. Lay S. N. a mother of three children, all of  whom are employed in garment factories.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike to sell brooms

loans.name: Ainura's Group

texts.en:
Ainura B. is the leader of this group. She is the resident of Bokonbaevo, a nice village in Isykul region.  She is 33 and married. Her husband is engaged in cattle breeding. Together they bring up two daughters, both of them are at school. Thirteen years ago with the initial investment of 3000 soms Ainura started to sell convenience goods. Now she earns 10000 soms per month. With money received from the loan she wants to purchase sausages for sale. In the future Ainura wants to expand her business and build a big house for her family.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase sausages

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma S. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 42 years old. Alma is married and has six children. Her eldest child is 23 years old while the youngest is only four. To make a living, Alma owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. One of Alma's dreams is to see all her children finish college and have bright futures.

Alma joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alma has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Alma is requesting a new loan of 17000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Anecito

texts.en:
Anecito N. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. He is 44 years old. Anecito is married and has three children aged 20, 18 and 12. To make a living, Anecito owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Aside from farming, Anecito also owns a sari-sari store that his wife manages.

Anecito joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anecito has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Anecito is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Tharcisse

texts.fr: Tharcisse A. est cultivateur et aide mécanicien.  Il a 28 ans, il est marié, et il a 1 enfant qui a 1 an.  Il est client d’ACB depuis 2007, et il va utiliser son prêt pour l’achat d’une parcelle (champs).  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est, après avoir acheté cette parcelle, il va cultiver pour satisfaire les besoins de la famille.  Il n’y a pas des difficultés attendues de non-remboursement de ce crédit. Dans l’avenir, il voudrait construire des maisons à louer.  Pour la famille, il voudrait éduquer son enfant.
texts.en: Tharcisse A. is a farmer and assistant mechanic. He is 28 years old, married and the father of a one-year-old child. He has been a client of the microfinance institution Amasezerano Community Banking S.A. since 2007. He will use his loan to buy agricultural land. His strategy for the growth of his business consists in cultivating his field to provide for his family. We do not expect problems with the repayment of the loan. For the future he plans to build houses for rent. Regarding his family, he wants to have his child educated.

loans.use: To buy agricultural land

loans.name: Jambar Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité JAMBAR est créé depuis bientôt 5 ans. Il regroupe 19 femmes qui habitent le même quartier et ont pratiquement le même centre d'intérêt qui le développement de leur terroir. Elle sont nouées par des liens d'amitié et de parenté. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de KIGNABOUR2 

Madame ADAMA N°1 S. debout en sixième position à partir de la gauche sur la photo, en écharpe verte et mise en médaillon est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 59 ans. Elle est veuve et mère de 04 enfants.

Elle fait un petit commerce de produits divers tels: des fruits, du pain de singe, du sucre, du café, du lait etc.

Son nouveau crédit lui permettra de mieux développer son activité de petit commerce en augmentant son niveau d'approvisionnement.

Son objectif est de prendre en charge ses besoins personnels et de soutenir ses enfants dans la prise en charge de la nourriture
texts.en:
The solidarity group Jambar was created nearly five years ago. It is made up of 19 women who all live in the same neighborhood and share a common goal: developing their area. They know each other through ties of friendship and kinship. The group belongs to the Banc Villageois of Kignabour 2.

Mrs Adama N° 2 S., pictured sixth from the left, wearing  a green scarf and portrayed in the small inlay, chairs the group. She is 59 years old, widowed and the mother of four children. She runs a small business selling various products, such as fruit, baobab fruit (monkey bread), sugar, coffee, milk, etc. Her new loan will enable her to efficiently develop her small business thanks to the increased inventory. Her goal is to pay for her personal needs, support her children and provide them with food.

loans.use: To finance her small store

loans.name: Aijamal's Group

texts.en:
Aijamal K. K. is the leader of this group. She is the resident of Bokonbaevo, a nice village in Isyjuk region. She is 20 and married to a driver.  In order to make additional money two years ago Aijamal started to breed livestock. Reselling livestock animals after fattening, she earns 11000 soms per month. That profit made it possible for her to save money and purchase a piece of land for building a house. With money received from the loan Aijamal wants to purchase a bull calf for breeding. In the future she wants to start building a house.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase a bull-calf

loans.name: Anna Mae

texts.en:
Anna Mae P. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 25 years old and married. She is engaged in farming and particularly plants and harvests rice crops. She sells her harvest to the market. Anna Mae also owns and manages a sari-sari store. She sells various products like sugar and vinegar.

Anna Mae joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anna Mae has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Anna Mae is requesting a new loan of 17000 PHP which will be used to purchase seeds and fertilizers. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Sibia

texts.en:
Sibia has a mixed farm in Nyamira town in western Kenya that procudes tea, milk, and vegetables. She has been in the farming business for twenty years and employs 5 farmhands. She also earns income from the sale of cereals to the local market. Her biggest challenge in this business has been  the lack of organized markets for her products.

She has requested a loan of 45,000KES through Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The proceeds from this loan will be used to improve her farm and pay school fees for her children. In the future, she would like to improve her tea plantation and own at least 5 dairy cows.

Sibia is 40 years old and married with 5 children between the ages of 17 and 20. Three of the children are currently attending school.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 30-year-old single man from Nabatiehj.  He has been the owner of a shoes and clothes retail shop since 2005, with 11 years of experience in this field. Mohamad is well known in his region because of his ambitions and hard work.  He has a good reputation and most of his clients say that one day he will be a successful businessman.

Mohamad is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to buy new collections of clothes for the coming season.  He hopes to grow his business to wholesale, then expand aggressively in the clothing industry. He is would like to have a small family when his financial and social situation improves more.

loans.use: To buy new season clothes collection

loans.name: Mrs. Thon Khiev Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of seventeen people living in Prey Phni village in Takeo province. The group members have selected Mrs. Thon K. as the village bank president.  The members will use their portion of the loan for different purposes to improve their family living. 

Mrs. Thon K. is a weaver.  She works from home and earns a small income to support her family. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand.  To achieve this purpose, Mrs. Thon K. is applying for a loan to buy more silk. 

Mrs. Thon K. is a widow with four children, two of whom are employed in garment factories and the others are construction workers. 

All the members in the group loan are shown in the picture, although one blocked.

loans.use: To buy silk

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty is currently in a business of selling mandaze, salt,soap and sugar. She is 29 Years old, married to a builder with three children and two of them go to school.  She wants to borrow a loan to stock more bags of sugar, salt and bars of soap. Betty hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: Stock of more bags of sugar, salt and bars of soap to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: She wants to make her beauty salon larger

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a farmer from the town of Nyamira in western Kenya. She has been in the farming business for 20 years and employs one farmhand. Her mixed farm produces tea, vegetables, maize, beans, and potatoes, which are all sold locally. She also earns income from the sale of second hand clothes to the local market.

Lucy is 33 years old and is married with three children. Two of her children are currently attending school.

She has requested a loan of 45,000KES through Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says that her family will be guaranteed enough milk for domestic consumption and sale. The extra income from the sale of milk will help her pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Benita

texts.en:
Benita P. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 44 years old. Benita is married. To make a living, Benita owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Benita currently earns 4000 PHP from rice farming. She hopes to improve her income.

Benita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Benita has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Benita is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her family financially.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Éric

texts.fr: Eric N. est aide mécanicien, et client d’ACB depuis 2007.  Il est célibataire, et né a Rwanda.  Il va utiliser son prêt pour l’achat des tôles et madriers pour renouveler sa maison d’habitation.  Apres la construction d’une belle maison d’habitation, Eric voudrait se marier, et avoir une famille.
texts.en: Éric N. is an assistant mechanic. He has been a client of the microfinance institution Amasezerano Community Banking S.A. since 2007. He is single and was born in Rwanda. He will use his loan to buy metal sheets and beams for the renovation of his house. After the reconstruction of his beautiful home he wants to marry and found a family.

loans.use: To buy metal sheets and beams for the renovation of his house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To maintain his work truck

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane N. K. is 56 years old, married, and supporting a family of four children. Jane is a quarry miner and works on her own piece of land.  She has been quarrying for the last ten years.

She learned about KADET from other women in a group already registered with KADET who live in her area of residence. This will be her second loan.  She is planning to use it to buy more quarry tools and to hire more manpower. She hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand her business.

Jane’s dream is to be rich and successful in life and to provide a better future for her children. She is a meticulous woman who is determined to achieve her set goals.

loans.use: To buy more quarry tools and hire labor

loans.name: Khodor

texts.en:
Khodor is a 28-year-old married man.  He is the father of two children.  He has been painting furniture since 2005 and has 15 years of experience. Khodor was 13 years old when he first started working in this business.  Since childhood, he had help his parents earn their living.  That is why everyone can rely on him, from his neighbors' point of view. 

Khodor is a man with good manners, liked by most of his friends, neighbors and relatives. His clientele increases day after day, and he hopes to expand his business to manufacture house furniture, doors and kitchens.

This is the first time Khodor has requested a loan from Al Majmoua.  He plans to use the loan to buy the necessary tools for his business and get a new bedroom for his baby boy.

loans.use: To buy tools for business & bedroom for new baby

loans.name: Jenalyn

texts.en:
Jenalyn S. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 35 years old. Jenalyn is married and has two children aged 16 and 14. To make a living, Jenalyn owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Like any other mother, she wants her children to finish college and have bright futures.

Jenalyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jenalyn has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Jenalyn is requesting a new loan of 17000 PHP which will be used to buy seeds, fertilizers and feeds. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to their house.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and feeds

loans.name: Olimjon

texts.ru: Бобокулов Олимчон житель района Шахритус. Ему 32 года. Женат. Имеет двоих детей. Дети маленькие. Жена домохозяйка. Сам Олимчон имеет среднее образование. Более 10 лет занимается растениеводством. У него имеется земельный участок, где он выращивает овощи. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений и топлива для трактора.
texts.en: B. Olimjon lives in the Shahrituz region. He's thirty-two years old, married and has four small children.Olimjon has a high-school level of education and, for the past ten years, has raised crops. He owns a plot of land, where he grows vegetables. He's asking for a loan in order to acquire some mineral fertilizers and fuel for his tractor.

loans.use: To purchase mineral fertilizers and fuel

loans.name: Sop Serigne Babacar Sy Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité SOP SERIGNE BABACAR SY est créé depuis bientôt 05 ans. Il est composé de 22 femmes qui sont toutes issues du même quartier. Leur activité dominante est la vente de fruits de saison. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de KIGNABOUR2 

Madame ABY D.,debout en seconde position à partir de la droite sur la photo, emmitouflée d'une écharpe blanche et mise en médaillon est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 60. Elle est veuve et mère de 06 enfants. 

Elle fait un petit commerce de poisson frais et de légumes. Elle maitrise bien cette activité pour l'avoir menée depuis plus de 10 ans. 

Son nouveau prêt lui permettra de mieux développer son petit commerce afin d'accroitre ses revenus financiers. 

Les bénéfices qu'elle réalise lui permettent d'acheter de la nourriture pour ses enfants et et petits enfants.
texts.en: The solidarity group Sop Serigne Babacar Sy was created nearly 5 years ago.  It is made up of 22 women who all come from the same neighborhood.  Their predominant business is the sale of seasonal fruits.  The group is a member of the Village Bank of Kignabour 2.  Madame Aby D., standing second to the right of the photo, in a white scarf and pictured in the inset, is the leader of the group.  She is 60 years old.  She is a widow and the mother of 6 children.  She runs a small business selling fresh fish and vegetables.  Her talent in this business has allowed her to run it successfully for more than 10 years.  Her new loan will allow her to develop her small business in order to increase her financial revenues.  The profits she makes will allow her to buy food for her children and grandchildren.

loans.use: Purchase of fish and vegetables

loans.name: Adil

texts.en: M. is currently in a business of selling matooke and yams. She is 35 years old, married to a businessman with seven children and only two go to school. M. borrowed a loan to stock more matooke and yams. She hopes to increase her business in future.

loans.use: Stock more matooke(unripped bananas) and yams.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena G. is from the village of Lugdungan. She is 33 years old, single, and has one school aged child. Rowena operates a family member's business in the retail sector, running a general store in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over eight years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month.

In 2010, Rowena joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase materials for her store renovation. Rowena is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products for her sari-sari store. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Rowena from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods to sell

loans.name: Snooky

texts.en:
Snooky T. is from the village of Polo. She is 39 years old, married, and has fout school aged children. Snooky operates a family member's business in the food sector, selling fresh fish and other sea foods in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over 7 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month.

In 2006, Snooky joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. Snooky is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fresh fish to sell . This will be the 8thh loan taken out by Snooky from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: use to purchase fresh fish

loans.name: Daylinda

texts.en:
Daylinda E. is from the village of Olingan. She is 62 years old, married, and has four adult children. Daylinda operates a family member's business in the agriculture sector, raising pigs in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month.

In 2008, Daylinda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,000 PHP from PMPC. Daylinda is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase piglets and feeds for her business. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Daylinda from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.


About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and feeds

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn A. is from the village of Brgy.1. She is 23 years old, married, and has 1 infant aged child. Analyn operates a family member's business in the retail sector, running a general store in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over 2 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month.

In 2010, Analyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan amounting of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. Analyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products for her sari-sari store. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Analyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario G. is from the village of Lugdungan. She is 55 years old, married and has six adult children. Rosario operates a family member's business in the agriculture sector, primarily planting rice in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month.

In 2010, Rosario joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Rosario is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers for her rice. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Rosario from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for her rice

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn A., is from the barangay of Malaubang, Ozamiz City. She is 48 years old, married and has three children. To make a living, Evelyn owns and operates a seaweeds production and fish selling activity. She has been in business for over 10 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Evelyn joined PMPC to access financial services to improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Evelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. Evelyn is now requesting a loan of 13,000 PHP to purchase a fishing net. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Evelyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the living conditions of her family.


About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.



*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy a fishing net

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi, 24, is a farmer from Nyamira town in western Kenya. She has been farming for the last 4 years and employs one farmhand. Her main products are potatoes, tea, milk and vegetables, which are all sold locally. She also earns income from her business selling charcoal to the local market.

She has requested a loan of 30,000KES through Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will help improve her family's livelihood. She plans to expand her tea plantation in the next 5 years.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Yashar

texts.ru:
Yashar M. 48 let. On jenat i imeyet 2 detey. Odin iz yeqo detey uchistya v kolledje a druqoy v shkole. Yashar Yavlyayetsya IDP personom on pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda i seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione.

On uje 10 let kak zanimayetsya etim biznessom prodaji pishevix produktov, Yashar ranshe ne imel svoy lichniy maqazin on bral pomesheniye v arendu no 5 let kak on imeyet sobstvennoye pomesheniye(magazin), Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi rasshirit svoyo pomesheniye dlya razmesheniya novix tovarov.
texts.en:
Yashar M. is 48 years old. He is married and has two children. One of his children is going to college and another one goes to school. Yashar is a locally displaced person and has relocated from the town of Fuzulli and now lives in the Fuzulli region. 

He has been in the business of selling food for ten years. Yashar did not have own store before and rented out a space, but since five years ago he has his own store space. Right now he needs 2000 AZN to expand the space of the store to include and offer new items.

loans.use: To expand store space

loans.name: Mirembe Women's Group-Nyenje-Mukono

texts.en:
45-year-old M. Robinah runs a growing poultry business in Nyenje-Mukono. It is a business that she and her husband, with whom she has 6 children, started 9 years ago.  Robinah was previously involved in a business selling bricks.  

She says hard work, prayers, persistence and determination have been her stocks in trade. Weekly, the poultry business generates for her 1,000,0000 shillings. With this loan, Robinah says she is going to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand poultry business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: she want to buy materials for her business

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella is currently in a business of selling clothes. She is 35 years old, married to an NGO worker with one child. Stella hopes to increase her business with extra profits in the future.

loans.use: stock more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Placide

texts.fr: Placide M. est né à Rwanda, et il est client d’ACB depuis 2007.  Il est conducteur d’une mototaxi avec une éducation d’école primaire.  Il a 37 ans, il est marié, et il a 4 enfants entre 2 ans et 7 ans.  Deux de ses enfants vont à l’école.  Il va utiliser son prêt pour payer les frais de mutation, et l’achat d’assurance, pneus, et pièces de rechange pour son moto.  Il n’y a pas des difficultés attendues de non-remboursement de ce crédit.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est de travailler beaucoup d’heures de la journée, et épargner.  Il voudrait acheter une voiture, et pour sa famille, construire une nouvelle maison d’habitation.
texts.en: Placide M. was born in Rwanda, and has been a client of ACB since 2007.  He drives a motorcycle taxi and has a primary school education.  He is 37 years old, married and has four children between the ages of 2 and 7.  Two of his children go to school.  He is going to use his loan to pay for transfer costs and the purchase of insurance, tires, and spare parts for his motorcycle.  He is not expected to have difficulties with the repayment of his loan.  His strategy to increase his business is to work many hours a day and to save.  He would like to buy a car, and construct a new house for his family to live in.

loans.use: To pay for transfer costs, purchase insurance, tires and spare parts

loans.name: Faysal

texts.ar:
فيصل في عمر 50 سنة يعمل في محل لبيع المواد الغذائية له في عمله 18 سنة متزوج وله 3 اولاد يحب عائلته وهي كل اهتمامه
له تاريخ جيد مع المجموعة يريد ان يحسن وضع عائلته وتعليم اولاده يجد صعوبة في راس المال فقط لتطوير مصلحته يحلم في 
امتلاك عمل خاص به وانشاء سوبر ماركت كبيرة حتى تصبح مقصدا لزبائنه الذين هم من جيرانه واقاربه يريد من خلال طلب
قرض من المجموعة الى شراء مواد غذائية واضافتها الى البضائع الموجودة حتى يزيد من رأس ماله وتكبير مصلحته
texts.en: FaysA., 50, is married with three children. He has been working in selling grocery items for 18 years. He loves his family who enjoy his full care and support. FaysA. has a good credit history with A. Majmoua. He wishes to improve his family conditions and educate his children well. FaysA. works at a grocery but lacks the capitA. necessary for developing his business. He looks forward to owning a bigger grocery store. His clients are his neighbors and relatives. He wants to get a loan from A. Majmoua to buy new inventory items to increase his stock and expand his business.

loans.use: To buy more grocery inventory  to expand business

loans.name: Mrs. Phai Phea Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Phai P. is the president of this group loan in Prey Phni village in Takeo province.  She has been selected by the sixteen people  who make up this village bank loan.  The members will use their portion of the loan in various ways to improve their family living. 

Mrs. Phai Pea weaves silk from her home to earn money to support her family.  She is very busy with silk weaving because her customers need a lot of silk clothes. So she wants to expand her business.  To achieve this goal, Mrs. Phai P. is asking for a loan to buy more silk. Her husband, Mr. Kea Chan, is a construction worker and a farmer.  He owns a plot of land where he grows rice to sell to support his family. Through these activities, they support three children, one of whom is enrolled in local public school, while the others are still too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy more silk

loans.name: Jaafar

texts.ar:
جعفر في عمر 23 سنة اعزب يعمل في استراحة لبيع البيتزا والعصير والمثلجات له في عمله 3 سنوات يحب عمله ويسعى دائما
الى تحسين وضعه وتطويره وخاصة انه في طور بناء مستقبله فهو طموح مثابر ومصر على تحسين مستواه المعيشي ما يميز جعفر انه
محب لعمله فهو دائما العمل مكد يتميز البصدق في المعاملة والنظافة يرد زيادة مدخوله وافتتاح مصلحة جديدة له ليزيد
من مدخوله يريد من خلال طلب قرض له من المجموعة الى شراء بضائع خطوط تشريج وتلفونات مستعملة واكسسوار تلفونات حتى يزيد
من مدخوله فهو متطور جدا ويريد دائما الاستمرارية في العمل
texts.en: Jaafar, 23, is single. He has been selling pizza, juice and other refreshments at a rest area.  He likes his work and is keen to improve it. He wishes to build a bright future with his ambition and perseverance. He works hard to improve his living standard. Jaafar is an eager beaver. He is also honest and always complies with hygienic standards at work.  He wants to increase his income by starting up a new business. Jaafar wants a loan from Al Majmoua to buy used mobile phones, prepaid lines and accessories. He wishes to improve his financial conditions and is always looking to develop his business.

loans.use: To purchase used mobile phones, prepaid lines and accessories to resell

loans.name: Nazia's Group

texts.en:
Nazia belongs to Gujranwala which is a mid-sized city of Pakistan and known for its rice industry. She lives there in the area named Gondalanwala with her family in a two room brick house for the past 15 years. 

She is a housewife, prefers to stay at home and does her household responsibilities. Her husband’s name is M. H. and he operates a grocery store in the market through which he sells daily use items like cooking oil, sugar, rice and spices etc.  His store is located in the busiest market, so to retain his customers and fulfills the timely need of them he needs to fill his store with each necessary items.  

Therefore, Nazia has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy groceries in bulk quantity for his grocery store which will increase his sales and earns good income for him.
  
Nazia is new loan applicant of Asasah and hopes that it will be profitable experience for her husband. 

Note: “In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Nazia”.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery store business

loans.name: Djamaladdin

texts.ru:
Djamaladdin I. 23 qoda. On jenat i imeyet 1 rebonka kotoromu 1 qod. Djamaladdin yavlyayetsya IDP personom on pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda , i seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey lubimoy semyoy. 

Etot molodoy chelovek uje 3 qoda kak zanimayetsya skotovodstvom, etomu biznessu on nauchilsya u svoyeqo dyadi kotoriy i pomoq yemu nachat zanatsya etim biznessom. Djamaladdin ochen lubit svoix jivotnix , on delayet sir, yogurt, kefir i prodoyet prodkti v magazini. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chto bi kupit yeshe korovi dlya razvitiya svoyeqo biznesa.
texts.en:
Djamaladdin I. is 23 years old. He is married and has one child who is one years old. Djamaladdin is an internally displaced person and has relocated from the town of Fuzilli and now lives in the Fuzilli region together with his beloved family.

This young man has been doing animal husbandry for three years already. He learned this business from his uncle who helped him start the business. Djamaladdin loves his animals very much, he makes cheese, yogurt, buttermilk (kefir) and sells the product in the stores. Right now he needs 2000 AZN to buy additional cows for development of his business.

loans.use: To buy cows

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand his business

loans.name: Rafia's Group

texts.en:
Rafia has applied loan for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her brother in law who will utilize it for buying spare parts and repairing tools for his bicycle repairing shop. 
She is very supportive lady in nature. She lives with her family in the area named Gondalanwala which is located in a city Gujranwala, Pakistan. Her husband’s name is M. M. and he is a blacksmith by profession.  Her father in law is also an earning person in her family. Although, his age is 70 years old but he is still very active. He is also a blacksmith by profession. 
Rafia is a mother of 3 sons and a daughter. Only 2 of them are managed to get education and others are free and don’t do anything.  
Rafia is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In previous loan year, she has proved herself as a very responsible client by paying her installments on time and attending every meeting.  
She is hopeful that her brother in law will make good use of loan money and will increase his income by expanding his business. 
Note: “In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Rafia.

loans.use: To buy spare parts and repairing tools for bicycle repairing shop

loans.name: Alpha

texts.en:
Here is Alpha S., a small scale businessman in Kabala, a town in northern Sierra Leone. Alpha bakes and sells breads. He has been in this profession for many years now. He is requesting for a loan of SLL 2,000,000.00 from SMT/Kiva lenders for the first time. With the help of this loan, he will be able to buy bags of flour, yeast, oil, etc. in large quantity in order to produce a larger amount of breads. 

Alpha who was born in Kabala is married to businesswoman and the couple has three children – two in primary school and one in secondary school.

loans.use: Buys bags of flour, yeast, oil, etc. in large quantity in order to produce a larger amount of breads

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a shop and make her own beauty salon

loans.name: Saeda

texts.en:
Saeda is married to AbulHadi who owns a toy store in Jenin city. Saeda has one daughter and three sons, she works in farming, growing herbs and seasonal vegetables in a small farm that she has, next to the house.

Saeda's husband has a small toys store selling children toys and gift items which is the family's main source of income. Saeda took a loan from FATEN so that her husband can pay for the toys he bought recently to increase the income earned from the sale of the items in his store.

Saeda's husband AbdulHadi appears in the picture here as Saeda is a conservative woman.

loans.use: Purchase toys and childrens gifts to sell in his store

loans.name: Sajor A.

texts.en:
Sajor A. J. is approximately a thirty-five-year-old man. He was born in the village of Affair, in northern Sierra Leone. However, Sajor now lives in Kabala town together with his wife and two children who are attending primary school. Sajor has been a businessman for many years now. He sells drinks, sardines, powder milk, batteries, soaps, candles, etc.  

Sajor has requested for a loan of SLL 3,000,000.00 from Kiva field partner, Salone Micro Finance Trust (SMT), in order to expand his business. He will use the loan to buy the above mentioned items at wholesale to add to his current stock. In this way, his business will improve both in size and quality, attracting many customers into his business.

loans.use: Buys drinks, sardines, powder milk, batteries, soaps, candles, etc.

loans.name: Alusine

texts.en:
Alusine K. is approximately a forty-five-year-old man. He was born in Kabala, a  town in northern Sierra Leone where he is currently residing together with his wife and four children. His wife is a businesswoman and his children are attending primary and secondary schools.  Alusine sells rice, groudnuts, palm-oil, etc.  

Alusine is requesting for a loan of SLL 2,000,000.00 from Kiva field partner, Salone Micro Finance Trust (SMT), in order to expand his business. He will use the loan to buy the above mentioned items at wholesale to add to his current stock. In this way, his business will improve both in size and quality, attracting many customers into his business.

loans.use: Buys rice, groudnuts, palm-oil, etc. at wholesale to add to his current stock

loans.name: Nabil

texts.ar:
نبيل في عمر 28 سنة يعمل في نجارة والدهان تعهدات منازل له في عمله 12 سنة غير متزوج ولكنه يطمح الى تكوين عائلة
وبناء اسرة و تكون بأوضاع جيدة يحب عائلته ويريد ان يزيد من مدخوله ما يميز عمله هو انه متجدد وطموح في عمله له مع المجموعة تاريخ جيد وكان يلقلى الدعم الكامل وقد ساهم القرض السابق في زيادة مدخوله وتحسين عمله يريد من خلال طلب
قرض له من المجموعة الى شراء كومبرسور هواء و مولد كهربائي لزيادة أدواته وتحسين العمل. لضمان التجدد والاستمرارية في العمل في البدء كان يلقى صعوبة في المنافسة بحيث كانت تنقصه المادة
texts.en: Nabil, 28, has been working in house contracting and selling paints for 15 years. He is single but he wishes to start a family and secure a decent life for them. Nabil loves his parental family and seeks to increase his income. He is known for his ambition and his outstanding work. Nabil has a good credit history with Al Majmoua. He enjoyed his family's full support during his previous loan cycle. His previous loan helped him increase his income and improve his working conditions. Nabil wants a new loan to buy a compressor as it will help him be more productive and improve his work conditions. He wishes to develop and maintain his business despite the fierce competition he faces due to lack of capital.

loans.use: To buy a compressor to develop his business

loans.name: Akramjon

texts.en:
Akramjon uses his small van as a taxi, transporting passengers around his city. Akramjon started driving a taxi two years ago. He makes around $35 per day which is enough to support himself his wife and their four children. Akramjon is a positive influence on those around him and demonstrates responsibility and a good work ethic. He has requested a loan for $2000 USD to help pay for some maintenance on his taxi. We are grateful for this opportunity to assist him with his business and help keep him out on the road earning a living. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing spare parts for maintenance his minivan

loans.name: Shamim's Group

texts.en:
Shamim has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the expansion of her cloth selling business. She started this business six years ago in order to share the financial burden with her husband. She buys clothes from city Lahore and sells in her local city Gujranwala. 
Gujranwala is a midsized city of Punjab Pakistan and known for its rice industry. She lives there in the area named Gondalanwala with her family in a three room brick house.  She shifted here since her marriage 21 years ago. 
Her husband is a blacksmith by profession. He makes spare parts and iron rods on order and earns income for the family. He is operating this business for past 20 years and is an expert in his field. 
Shamim has given birth to two sons and two daughters. Her elder son drives a van and offers pick and drop services to school and college students. Younger son is an electrician by profession. Her daughters are studying in 11th and 10th grades respectively. 
She is very hopeful that an investment will take her business to more profitable position. 
She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In previous loan year, she has established a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting. 
Note: “In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Shamim”.

loans.use: To buy clothes for selling

loans.name: Damba

texts.en:
Here is Damba T., a small scale businesswoman in Kabala, a town in northern Sierra Leone. Damba sells groundnuts, palm-oil, pepper, “bitter kola”, etc.  She has been a businesswoman for many years now. She is requesting for a loan of SLL 2,000,000.00 from SMT/Kiva lenders for the first time. With the help of this loan, he will be able to buy groundnuts, palm-oil, pepper, bitter kola, etc. in large quantity to add to her business. 

Damba who was born in Kabala, she is married to farmer and the couple has three children – two in primary school and one in secondary school.

loans.use: Buys groundnuts, palm-oil, pepper, bitter kola, etc. in large quantity to add to her business

loans.name: Zokirjon

texts.en:
Zokirjon is a young married man. He lives in Isfara, Northern Tajikistan. Zokirjon sells car spare parts is his home. He runs this business together with his father. Zokirjon has been in this business for 10 years. Zokirjon is requesting a loan of 7500 Somoni to increase his working capital. Main characteristics of his business are consistency and stability. Zokirjon is hoping to keep his business running and efficient in the future. One of his short-term plans is to open vending location in his home town.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of the spare parts for car in order to increase the range of goods

loans.name: Isaac Ngotho

texts.en:
Isaac is 53 years old. He is married to Petrolina and supports six members of his family. He has a farm and also keeps poultry for commercial purposes. He has been in this business for a period three years, earning an income of about KES 5,000 per month.

This is his second loan from KADET LTD after successfully repaying the previous one. He hopes to become the main poultry supplier in Matuu and the entire Yatta.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and chicks to rear

loans.name: Sorie K.

texts.en: Pictured here is Sorie K. M..  The forty-four-year-old was born in Kabala town; he has four children; his wife is businesswoman and his children are attending primary and secondary schools. For many years now, Sorie has been selling spare-parts such as tyres, inner tubes, driving chairs, etc. and house building materials such as nails.  Sorie is seeking for a loan of SLL 5,000,000 for the first time from SMT/Kiva lenders in order to further expand his business. With this loan, he will buy the above mentioned items in large quantity to add to his business.

loans.use: Buys tyres, inner tubes, driving chairs, nails, etc.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.ar:
زينب في عمر 44 سنة متزوجة ولها ولدان تعمل في بيع المواد الغذائية والمعلبات والسكاكر ميني ماركت تحب عائلتها
وتريد لها دائما التجدد والاستقرار خاصة في ظل وضع مادي ضعيف تريد دائما التطور والتحسن في المجتمع فهي طموحة 
مثابرة ومتطورة لها في عملها 15 سنة لها تاريخ جيد في المجموعة وقد ساهم القرض السابق في فتح مصلحة خاصة لها وهي تجارة
الالبسة تريد من خلال طلب قرض لها من المجموعة الى شراء بضائع جديدة البسة حتى تتمكن من زيادة مدخولها ودعم عائلتها
المادي والاجتماعي
texts.en: Zainab, 44, is married with two children. She works at a mini-market where she sells foodstuffs like sugar, groceries, and canned foods. Zainab is ambitious and persevering and likes to be up–to-date in her work. She has been working in the grocery business for 15 years. She wishes to secure for her family stable living conditions with her limited financiA. resources.  Zainab also wants to enjoy a better status in her community. She has a good credit history with A. Majmoua. The previous loan she had helped her start her own ready-made clothes business. Zainab wants to get a new loan to buy new clothes stock so that she can increase her income and improve her family's financiA. and sociA. conditions.

loans.use: To buy new clothes for trade

loans.name: Kenneth Macharia

texts.en:
Kenneth Macharia is 36 years old.  He is married to Faith Waithera, who also works to contribute to the family income. They have two children aged five and two. Kenneth has been in the transport business for a period of one year.  He earns a profit of about KES 7,200 per  month.

This is his first loan, which he wants to use to service his motorcycle in order to operate better. He hopes to buy his own passenger vehicle and educate his children to the highest level.

loans.use: To service motorbike

loans.name: Mirzokosim

texts.en:
Since he was a young Mirzokosim has known to work. His parents taught him how to get by as an agriculturist and he learned very well. Now that he is the father of two children and still works as an agriculturalist. Thanks to his parents Mirzokosim now has the opportunity to move forward as a farmer and he hopes to increase his agricultural products so that he can bring his loved ones a more promising life. Despite being a good agriculturalist and worker he needs help to move forward and improve his production. This is why he is asking for a loan, so that he can buy more of the seeds and fertilizers he needs, which are very expensive, but without them his production will not improve. You can help Mirzokosim keep moving forward with his development plans.    

 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Robert Kitti

texts.en:
Robert Kitti N. is a 26-year-old man from Mariakani. He is married to Betty and together they have one child. Robert owns a beauty shop and has been in this business for the past two years. 


This is his first loan from KADET,and he plans to use it to purchase hair products for his business. Robert plans to repay the loan with the anticipated profits.  His dream is to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase hair products

loans.name: Esan

texts.en:
Esan is a hard-working, persistent entrepreneur from Tursunzade, in Southern Tajikistan. Ten years ago he decided to try opening his own small grocery sales business. Today, his business is successful and he is looking to expand it further. Esan has requested a loan of $1200 so that he can purchase additional foodstuff for his grocery. He plans to increase the variety of items he has available for customers to use in making this ever-popular delicacy. Esan is married and has four children. One of his goals for his business is to be able to help his children as he can. We are happy for this opportunity to assist this responsible, dedicated business owner as he works to improve his livelihood. 

 




More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
