The members of the rural communal bank Nuevo Amanecer ("New Dawn") meet on the grounds of San Luís de Zapotal in the canton of Ventanas. This group of 12 members works in agriculture in short-cycle sowing of corn and rice.

Venicia Azucena is a farmer. She grows corn and rice. She buys her agricultural supplies from Ecua-química and sells her products at the same place.

She applies for a loan to finance her sowing of corn and rice. She needs agricultural consumables and seeds. The loan will help her to pay for the required supplies. She faces challenges such as plagues, diseases and weather changes. Her dream is to see her children study. She likes socializing with friends.

loans.use: To buy agricultural consumables and seeds

loans.name: Favio Javier

texts.es:
Fabio de profesión agricultor, su esposa ama de casa y le ayuda en la finca. Tiene como planes mejorar el sistema de agua potable de su finca así mismo invertir para proteger al cultivo. Ya que se le ha presentado una diversidad de plagas que han sido un problema para él.  Inicio con el apoyo de la reforma agraria. Planes a corto plazo tiene la renovación de piñas de poca producción por variedad de piña que rinda. 
El préstamo que solicitad en este ciclo es para brindarle asistencia al cultivo de piña comprando: fertilizantes y así mejora la producción obtener mayores utilidades e invertir la utilidad en la finca.
texts.en:
Fabio is a farmer and his wife is a housewife who helps him with the farm. He plans to improve his farm's potable water system, investing in protecting his crops. A diverse amount of plagues have posed a problem for his crops. He started farming after the agrarian reform. His short term plans are to replace his low-producing pineapple plants with a variety that produces more.
The loan that he is requesting in this cycle is to assist his pineapple cultivation, buying fertilizers. This will improve his production so that he can obtain a greater income and invest it in the farm.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of fertilizer for his crops

loans.name: Adriana Katiny

texts.es:
Adriana Katiny M. V. tiene 18 años, vive en Unión libre con su esposo en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. No Tiene  hijos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. NUEVO AMANECER se encuentra ubicada en el recinto San Luís de Zapotal pertenece al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla de 12 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en ciclo corto de siembra de maíz, arroz.

Adriana Katiny se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en  Farma-Agros  y vende en el mismo lugar.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, y arroz, compra de insumos y semillas. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener bienestar en su familia

Le gusta  mirar televisión, y salir a las fiestas
texts.en:
Adriana Katiny M. V., aged 18, lives in a common-law marriage with her husband in the canton of Ventanas in the province of Los Ríos. She has no children.

The members of the rural communal bank Nuevo Amanecer ("New Dawn") meet on the grounds of San Luís de Zapotal in the canton of Ventanas. This group of 12 members works in agriculture in short-cycle sowing of corn and rice.

Adriana Katiny is a farmer. She grows corn and rice. She buys her agricultural supplies from Farma-Agros and sells her products at the same place.

She applies for a loan to finance her sowing of corn and rice. She needs agricultural consumables and seeds. The loan will help her to pay for the required supplies. She faces challenges such as plagues, diseases and weather changes. Her dream is to enjoy well-being in her family. She likes watching television and partying.

loans.use: To buy agricultural consumables and seeds

loans.name: Las Palmas Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama las palmas que se integra de cinco señoras quien cada una cuenta con su actividad, la razón del nombre de su grapo es porque son puras señoras.

      La señora María del Carmen Hernández Hernández, vive en localidad de Benito Juárez, municipio de Copainala Estado de Chiapas México, es casada con el señor Rosemberg  Hernández Jiménez, en donde procrearon tres hijos quienes a un están a su responsabilidad y son: María Elizabeth de veintidós años, Olga Leticia de de quince años de edad,  en tercero de secundaria y el ultimo es Carlos Antonio de de once años de edad.

    El préstamo que a estado solicitado lo  invierte en la compra y venta  de productos agrícolas como el guineo que se vende  muy bien las comunidades cercanas, en esta actividad lleva  cuatro años  y le a dado buenos resultados.
 
     Inicio  por si sola ya que  en su ribera se da ese producto y el cual la gente lo compra mucho, y pues ella tiene su propia cosecha, así es aprovechar  el producto.

      De las ganancias que va obteniendo lo invierte para comprar más guineo y así  tener regular, como mejor sea su resultado y con ello ser de manera puntual  en sus pagos del préstamo solicitado.
Su deseo es que con esta actividad logre a horrar, para que con esto trabajo y la ayuda de su esposo logren apoyar a sus dos hijos que están estudiando y así logren terminar una carrera.

     Las persona que integran el grupo son  las siguientes:.

      María Del Carmen Sánchez Sánchez: invierte el préstamo en la compra  de productos agrícolas cono es el guineo.
     Rosa Vázquez Castellanos: invierte el préstamo en la compra de de ingredientes para la elaboración de dulces típicos de la región, como también se dedica a la engorda de marranos.

    María Guadalupe M. Hernández: invierte el préstamo en la compra y venta de guineo, como también surte su refresquería.

    María Rosalba Juárez M.: invierte el préstamo en la compra y venta de pollos de rancho para venderlo en el mismo municipio.

    María Del Socorro Jiménez Sánchez: invierte el préstamo en la compra  y venta de marranos.
texts.en:
The name of the group is "Las Palmas" and it is made up of 5 women, each owning their own business. The name "Las Palmas" was chosen because the group is exclusively made up of women. 

Maria del Carmen H. H. lives in the region of Benito J. of the Copainala municipality, in the state of Chiapas, Mexico. She is married with Mr. Rosemberg H. J., and they had three children together, all of whom are still in their care. They are: Maria Elizabeth, 22 years old, Olga Leticia, 15 years old and in grade 9, and the youngest is Carlos Antonio, 11 years old. 

The loan requested will be invested in the business of buying and selling agricultural products such as bananas, product that sells very well in the nearby communities. this business is four years old and it has been very successful. 

She started the business on her own, seeing that this product grows very well in her region and it is in high demand.  she has her own plantation and so she is able to benefit from her harvests.

The profits she earns are invested in the purchase of more bananas to maintain a steady income. She will therefore be able to make the payments for the loan she requests. 

Her wish is to be able to save money through her business so that she will be able to support her two children while they are in school, and to see them accomplish training for a career.

The individuals who make up the group are the following: 

Maria Del Carmen S. S.: she will invest her loan in the purchase of agricultural products such as bananas. 

Rosa V. Castellanos: she will invest her loan in the purchase of ingredients to make sweets that are traditional to the region. She also raises pigs.

Maria Guadalupe M. H.: she will invest her loan in the purchase and resale of bananas, and to supply her canteen. 

Maria Rosalba J. M.: she will invest her loan in the purchase of chickens which will be resold in the same municipality. 

Maria Del Socorro J. S.: she will invest her loan in the purchase of pigs for later resale.

loans.use: To purchase bananas for resale.

loans.name: Marliz Viviana

texts.es:
Marliz Viviana B. M. tiene 22 años, vive en Unión Libre con su esposo,  en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. Tiene 1 hijo. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. NUEVO AMANECER se encuentra ubicada en el recinto San Luís de Zapotal pertenece al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla de 12 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en ciclo corto de siembra de maíz, arroz.

Marliz Viviana se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en  Agro Servicios San Jacinto y vende en el mismo lugar.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, y arroz, compra de insumos y semillas. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener bienestar en su familia

Le gusta  hacer muchos amigos, salir a la fiestas de carnaval
texts.en:
Marliz Viviana B. M., aged 22, lives in a common-law marriage with her husband in the canton of Ventanas in the province of Los Ríos. She has one child.

The members of the rural communal bank Nuevo Amanecer ("New Dawn") meet on the grounds of San Luís de Zapotal in the canton of Ventanas. This group of 12 members works in agriculture in short-cycle sowing of corn and rice.

Marliz Viviana is a farmer. She grows corn and rice. She buys her agricultural supplies from Agro Servicios San Jacinto and sells her products at the same place.

She applies for a loan to finance her sowing of corn and rice. She needs agricultural consumables and seeds. The loan will help her to pay for the required supplies. She faces challenges such as plagues, diseases and weather changes. Her dream is to enjoy well-being in her family. She likes having a lot of friends and going to the carnival festivities.

loans.use: To buy agricultural consumables and seeds

loans.name: Elias

texts.es:
Don Elías, reside en Semsembra departamento de Morazán, donde vive con su esposa, sus hijos, don Elías tiene 61 años de edad, se dedica a la crianza de ganado, inicio este negocio desde que era joven trabajando todo el día en el mantenimiento del ganado y en el cultivo de maíz y frijol, esto le ha permitido ganar experiencia.
Por el momento está necesitando un préstamo para la compra de harinilla y concentrado para el ganado esto le ayudara a mantener alimento para un buen tiempo en el verano, beneficiándole con la facilidad de contar con un inventario.
Su sueño es tener la posibilidad de que sus hijos asistan a la universidad para que se preparen académicamente y puedan accesar a un empleo bien remunerado, también sueña con un crecimiento en el negocio como ganadero para proveer ingresos y sostener los gastos del hogar y tener un estilo de vida más estable.
texts.en:
Elias lives in Semsembra, in the department of Morazan. He lives together with his wife and their children. Elias is 61 years old and he is a cattle farmer. He started the business when he was very young, working all day raising their cattle and tending the corn and bean plantations.  This has earned him a great deal of experience. 

He requests a loan to purchase cornmeal and concentrated feed for the cattle. it will help him secure the feed he needs to ensure a good summer season, improving his inventory. 

His dream is to see his kids go to university and to be academically ready to access a well-paid employment. He also dreams to expanding his business to increase his income and support the house hold to have a more stable quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase cattle feed.

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
la señora Maria B. tiene 26 años de edad, vive desde hace 8 años en la colonia Morazan de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, vive en union libre y tiene un hijo.
actualmente tiene un negocio de pulperia en donde vende abarroteria en general como ser: arroz, carnes, pollo, lacteos, jabon, churros y todo lo relacinado con la canasta basica familiar.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia ya que desea surtir un poco mas la pulperia y asi lograr mejores ganancias.
 
las ganancias las necesita para cubrir con los gastos del hogar y para mantener a su hijo.
texts.en:
Maria B. is 26 years old and she has lived in the colony of Morazan in the city of San Lorenzo for the past 8years. She lives with her common-law partner and their son.

She has a convenience store from where she sells grocery store items in general, such as: rice, meats, chicken, milk products, soaps, snacks, and all the basic things for the family.

She will use the loan to purchase merchandise to improve her supply of inventory for her store and to improve her earnings. 

She needs her earnings to cover the household expenses and to support her son.

loans.use: To purchase inventory for her general store.

loans.name: Jenny Margoth

texts.es:
Jenny Margoth V. Garcia tiene 32 años, vive en Unión Libre con su esposo,  en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. Tiene 1 hija. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. NUEVO AMANECER se encuentra ubicada en el recinto San Luís de Zapotal pertenece al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla de 12 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en ciclo corto de siembra de maíz, arroz.

Jenny Margoth se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en  Agro Servicios San Jacinto y vende en el mismo lugar.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, y arroz, compra de insumos y semillas. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener bienestar en su familia

Le gusta  hacer muchos amigos, salir a la fiestas de carnaval
texts.en:
Jenny Margoth V. G., aged 32, lives in a common-law marriage with her husband in the canton of Ventanas in the province of Los Ríos. She has one child.

The members of the rural communal bank Nuevo Amanecer ("New Dawn") meet on the grounds of San Luís de Zapotal in the canton of Ventanas. This group of 12 members works in agriculture in short-cycle sowing of corn and rice.

Jenny Margoth is a farmer. She grows corn and rice. She buys her agricultural supplies from Agro Servicios San Jacinto and sells her products at the same place.

She applies for a loan to finance her sowing of corn and rice. She needs agricultural consumables and seeds. The loan will help her to pay for the required supplies. She faces challenges such as plagues, diseases and weather changes. Her dream is to enjoy well-being in her family. She likes having a lot of friends and going to the carnival festivities.

loans.use: To buy agricultural consumables and seeds

loans.name: Firas

texts.en: Firas is a young man from Jenin. He is married and the father of one son. Firas is a promising singer and musician who produces Arabic fusion music. Firas is known in the Jenin area and in some of the Palestinian cities in the north. He took out a loan from Faten to purchase an electronic guitar in order to produce different kinds of music.

loans.use: to purchase an electronic guitar

loans.name: Anne

texts.en: Anne is 32 years old; she is married with five children who are between five months and ten years old, including a pair of twins.  Four of her children go to school. Her husband works as a taxi driver. Anne sells both food stuffs and soft drinks in her shop. She has spent six years in this business. She has requested this loan to buy more foodstuffs and soft drinks to sell. She hopes to use this new profit from expanded business to renovate and install electricity in her house. She would like to have a loan amount of five million in the future.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Rev-Marcelline

texts.en: Marcelline owns a business selling fruits, like yellow bananas. She is 39 years old. She has two children who are about twelve and sixteen years old. She decided to request a loan to buy more yellow bananas to sell. With the profits she will pay school fees for her children. In the future, Marcelline would like to make her business grow.

loans.use: To buy more fruits, especially yellow bananas, to sell.

loans.name: Sonia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Sonia, posee una tienda, resiD. en San Rafael Oriente, departamento D. San Miguel, vive con su esposo y dos nietos D. 18 y 22 años D. edad, Ella tiene 56 años D. edad, este negocio lo comenzó su madre cuando ella tenía 12 años D. edad y le ayudaba a atender a los clientes, cuando su madre falleció, ella decidió darle continuidad al negocio, hoy día tiene 21 años D. administrarlo atendiéndolo D. 6:00am a 4:00pm, hasta la fecha no ha tenido problemas, todo le ha salido bien con los clientes que le visitan.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para comprar frijol, aceite, azúcar, arroz, galletas y más productos que ofrece a los clientes, esto contribuirá a su negocio fortaleciéndolo y generando más utilidades para su hogar.
Doña Sonia espera que a través del negocio pueda apoyar a sus nietos para que asistan a estudio superiores y puedan defenderse en un futuro.
texts.en:
Sonia has her own store and resides in San Rafael Oriente, in the department of San Miguel. She lives with her husband and two grandchildren, who are 18 and 22 years old. She is 56 years old. Her business was started by her mother when she was 12 years old. Sonia helped attend to the customers. When her mother died, she decided to continue with the business. She has now been running it for 21 years, serving customers from 6:00am til 4:00pm. She has never had any problems with it and she has done well with the clients that visit her store. 

Sonia is asking for a loan to buy beans, cooking oil, sugar, rice, cookies and other products she offers her clients. This will strengthen her business and generate more revenues for her home. She hopes that her business can support her grandchildren and allow them to get a higher education and proviD. a future for themselves.

loans.use: The purchase of rice, beans, cooking oil, sugar, and cookies.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Reyes Group

texts.es:
La Banca Comunal “REYES” es un grupo de 8 mujeres y 1 varón que han decidido unirse para para recibir crédito, capacitación y atención en salud, es parte del centro focal de Senkata, este es su primer ciclo.
Cada una de ellas tiene negocio propio, tanto de servicio, producción o comercio. Entre ellos tenemos:   venta de limón y chancaca, costura de sombreros, venta de comida, venta de celulares, venta de osos, venta de dulces y refrescos, venta de papa, venta de productos de acuerdo a la época (por ejemplo si es Navidad, venderá juguetes, si es Carnaval vende globos y chisguetes).

 Para su organización, la B. C. Reyes cuenta con una mesa directiva integrada por una presidenta, la señora  Saturnina, una tesorera, la señora  Cristina y una secretaria de actas, la señora  Anna.
 
La Presidenta, la señora  Saturnina es viuda, tiene cuatro hijos, el mayor tiene 18 años y el menor 8 años.    El negocio de la señora  Saturnina se encuentra en la parada de un minibús, atiende desde las siente de la mañana hasta las cinco de la tarde y consiste en la venta de dulces y refrescos.   También, teje mantas, ambos negocios fueron iniciados por cuenta propia.  Para las ventas cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos.  El préstamo solicitado fue por Bs.1000.- y será destinado para la compra de mercadería.

La señora presidenta ya ha sido socia de  Pro Mujer hace tres años, durante un ciclo,  cuando se le consulta que es lo que le gusta de la institución, ella responde “el consultorio”.
texts.en:
La Banca Comunal "REYES" [The REYES Communal Bank] is a group of eight women and one man who have decided to join together to receive a loan, training, and health care, which is part of the central focus of Senkata. This is their first loan cycle. 

Each one of the women has her own business ranging from services and production to the sale of goods. Among them are: the sale of lemons and cakes, sewing of hats, food products, cell phones, teddy bears, sweets and soft drinks, potatoes, seasonal products (for example: if it is Christmas, she sells toys, if it is Carnaval, she sells balloons and drinks). 

La Banca Comunal "REYES" has a board of directors. Señora Saturnina is the president, Señora Cristina is the treasurer and Señora Anna is the secretary. 

The President, Señora Saturnina is a widow and has four children, the oldest is 18 years old and the youngest is eight years old. Her business is located at a minibus stop. She works from seven in the morning until five in the afternoon. She sells sweets and soft drinks and also weaves blankets. She started both business with her own money and her children help run the store. She has requested a loan for 1000 bolivianos and it will be used to purchase merchandise. 

The president has been a member of Pro Mujer for three years and one loan cycle. When she was asked what she likes about the organization, she says "the medical center".

loans.use: The purchase of merchandise.

loans.name: Alphonsine

texts.en: Alphonsine is 34 years old. She is a widow and has two children who are between two and six years old. Alphonsine has one dependent whom she cares and all her two children and one dependent are enrolled in school. Alphonsine sells vegetables and she has had this business for ten years. She says that her business was successful in that she gained a house from this business. With this new loan, she will buy more vegetables to sell. She said that with the new profits from her business she will establish a shop stocked with various items. In the future, she wishes to have a nice place compared to what she has currently.

loans.use: To buy vegetables to sell

loans.name: Dativa

texts.en: Dativa is 30 years old. She has four children and all of them except the youngest attend school. Dativa sells vegetables and she has been in this business for twelve years. Dativa has requested this loan to buy more vegetables to sell. She says that her business has contributed much because she managed to build a house from this business. She plans to make her business grow with the profits she intends to make. In the future, she wishes to invest in her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Iris Esperanza

texts.es:
la señora Iris Esperanza V. F. tiene 30 años de edad, esta casada con el señor Jose Rios quien trabaja en los Estados Unidos y le envia remesas para sus hijos.
la señora Iris tiene a su cargo cuatro hijos.
Iris desde hace cuatro años elabora tortillas y golosinas como ser tacos, enchiladas y pastelitos.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de materiales para la fabricacion de sus golosinas y las tortillas.
su mayor deseo es graduar a sus hijos de la universidad.
texts.en:
Iris Esperanza V. F. is 30 years old and she is married with Jose Rios who works in the United States and sends support money for their children. 

Iris has four children in her care. 

For the past four years Iris has been making tortillas and snacks, including tacos, enchiladas, and cupcakes. 

She will invest her loan in the purchase of ingredients for her snacks and tortillas.

Hr greatest dream is to see her children graduate from university.

loans.use: To purchase firewood and ingredients.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy merchandise like basic grains, cosmetics, canned goods, dairy products, and soft drinks

loans.name: Marvin Antonio

texts.es:
Marvín reside en Concepción Batres departamento de Usulután, se dedica a atender un  comedor y pupuseria, vive con su familia su esposa, su madre, su hijo de 2 años de edad.
Él inicio este negocio gracias al apoyo de su esposa que le ayuda a atender el negocio, el horario de atención es de 6:00am a 5:00pm, actualmente no cuenta con capital para invertir, por lo que solicita un préstamo para comprar mobiliario y materiales para fortalecer el negocio. Esta inversión le ayudara a crecer en el negocio y eso le permitirá contar con todo lo necesario para trabajar y ofrecer un mejor servicio a los clientes.
Sueña con poseer un negocio amplio y surtido, también aumentar los ingresos y ganancias para solventar las necesidades del hogar y estabilizar la condición de vida para todos.
texts.en:
Marvín lives in Concepción Batres in the Usulután department.  He devotes himself to a dining room and “pupusuría” (a business that specializes in selling “pupusas”, which are stuffed corn tortillas).  He lives with his family; his wife, his mother, and his two year old son.

He started this business thanks to his wife’s support.  She helps him take care of the business.  His work schedule is from 6:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m.  He does not currently have capital to invest.  That is why he is requesting a loan to buy furnishings and materials to strengthen the business.

This investment will help him grow in his business.  It will allow him to have everything that is necessary in order to work and offer better service to his customers.

He dreams of having a spacious and well-stocked business.  He also dreams of increasing his income and earnings in order to pay for the household necessities and establish a stable living condition for all.

loans.use: To buy furnishings and materials to prepare for his food sales

loans.name: Celestin

texts.en: Celestin sells goats. He is married and has four children who are between one and twelve years old. His wife is a business woman who sells cooking oil and sugar. Celestin has been selling goats for fifteen years. He needs this loan to buy more goats to sell. He intends to use the profits from this business to build his new planned house. In the future, he would like to hire his own vehicle for transporting goats instead of making contributions to various goat dealers.

loans.use: To buy more goats to sell

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice owns a boutique stocked with a variety of products. She is 33 years old, married, and has three children who are in the range of five to nine years old. One of her children goes to school. Her husband works as a soldier. From her business, she managed to buy a cow and helped her family to fix some family problems. She decided to get this new loan to buy more items such as school bags, shoes, and hand bags to sell. With the profits from her expanded business she hopes to build a house for her children. In the future, she would like to help the poor to meet their financial needs.

loans.use: To buy more school bags, shoes, and hand bags to sell

loans.name: Miriam Auxiliadora

texts.es:
Miriam madre soltera emprendedora mujer trabaja se desempeña como cocinera en un Restaurante sus aspiraciones en cambiar de trabajo en donde obtenga mayores ingresos para ofrecerle mayores posibilidades de estudios a sus hijos. Por falta de recursos económico no ha podrido terminar la construcción completa de su vivienda siendo unas de las principales necesidades ya que la seguridad y comodidad es importante.
Con el préstamo que solicita será utilizado para la compra de materiales de construcción como: cemento, hierro, arena, bloques, ladrillos, piedrines, piedra cantera, zinc, clavos y otros materiales para la construcción de un cuarto y remodelaciones de algunas paredes. Así obtendrá protección para su familia.  Agradeciendo a la financiera ya que se emprenderá en el inicio del cumplimiento de sus planes mejorar la infraestructura de la vivienda.
texts.en:
Miriam is an enterprising single mother.  She works as a cook in a restaurant though she has aspirations to change her job so that she can make more income which will enable her to offer her children a better education.  Through a lack of economic resources, Miriam has not been able to complete the building of her home and this is really necessary as her family's security and comfort are important to her.

Miriam will use the loan that she is requesting to buy building supplies such as: cement, iron, sand, blocks, bricks, gravel, quarry stone, sheets of corrugated metal roofing, nails and other materials so that she can build a room and remodel some walls.  This will help to protect her family.  Miriam is grateful to our financial institution since this will enable her to start carrying out her plans to improve the infrastructure of her home.

loans.use: To buy building supplies

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en: Jacqueline is 32 years old. She is married with two children who are twelve and fourteen years old. All her children attend school along with her other two other dependents. Her husband works as a motor vehicle mechanic. Jacqueline sells spare parts for various types of motor vehicles. She has been in this business for six years. From her business she says that she was able to do a lot of things like building a house and buying a car, and that all these tangible assets resulted from her business. Jacqueline has requested this loan to buy more spare parts to sell. She will use the profits that she expects to gain to reinvest in her business for its growth. She dreams of starting to import spare parts, which might yield preferable prices, in the future.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts to sell

loans.name: Wilmer Yohalmo

texts.es:
Wilmer, de 31 años de edad, reside en San Miguel, se dedica a la venta de CD y reparación de equipos de sonido, él vive en casa de su tío con su compañía, sus padres lo dejaron a cargo de don Santos quien ha hecho las veces de un padre, el negocio de Wilmer es la venta de CD de música, audífonos, y a la vez repara aparatos de sonido, su tío le enseño a manejar este negocio desde hace 10 años, el local está ubicado en el parqueo de buses.
Él está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de CD audio, Diskman y audífonos, esta compra la hará al mayoreo ya que de esta manera le permite negociar los precios obteniéndolos a menor costo para comercializarlo a buen precio para recibir ganancias.
La aspiración  de él es realizarse como persona, comerciante, y mejorar la condición económica acutal.
texts.en:
Wilmer is 31 years old, and he lives in San Miguel.  He sells CDs and repairs sound equipment.  He lives with his uncle in his uncle’s house.  His parents left him in his uncle’s care.  Santos has been a father to him.

Wilmer’s business is selling CD music, headphones, and repairing sound equipment.  His uncle taught him how to manage this business ten years ago.  His place of business is located at the bus parking lot.

He is requesting a loan to buy audio CDs, Diskman, and headphones.  He will make this purchase wholesale because that will allow him to negotiate the prices and get a lower price.  That way he will sell them for a good price and get earnings.

His aspirations are to fulfill himself as a person and merchant and to improve his current financial circumstances.

loans.use: To buy audio CDs, Diskman, and headphones

loans.name: Natalia

texts.es:
Natalia es socia del Banco Comunal San Jose de Viñaca, tiene 46 años, es casada y tiene 6 hijos. Se dedica a la venta de alfalfa y verduras como: lechuga, espinaca, albaca, rabanito apio, poro, zanahoria, choclo, papa, etc. Natalia tiene terrenos donde siembra todo tipo de verduras, su esposo tiene una combi y aprovecha en llevar sus verduras al mercado Nery García Zarate y Covadonga, ahí reparte sus verduras entre sus caseras y lo que le queda lo vende en su puesto del Mercado Covadonga. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en compra de remedios y semillas para su negocio. A Natalia le gusta Finca porque puede ahorrar y le dan créditos.
Su sueño es que su negocio crezca y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Natalia is a member of the San Jose de Viñaca Communal Bank.  She is 46 years old, married, and has six children.  She sells alfalfa and vegetables like lettuce, spinach, basil, radishes, celery, leeks, carrots, corn, and potatoes, etc.  Natalia has fields where she grows all types of vegetables.

Her husband has a “combi” (minivan used in public transportation), and she makes good use of it to take her vegetables to the Nery García Zarate market and to Covadonga.  She distributes her vegetables to households there.  She sells what is left at her stand at the Covadonga market. 

She will use the requested loan to buy remedies and seeds for her business.  Natalia likes Finca because she is able to save and they give loans.

Her dream is for her business to grow and for her children to become professionals.

loans.use: To buy treatments for the plants and seeds

loans.name: Juana Evangelista

texts.es:
Juana Evangelista H. es comerciante activa del Mercado Oriental de Managua desde hace quince años, ella trabaja de lunes a sábados de 6 de la mañana hasta las cinco  de la tarde, es madre de cuatro hijos dos menores de edad y uno se encuentra en edad escolar los otros mayores ya no dependen de ella.
El préstamo solicitado es para la compra de materiales de construcción como: zinc, perlines, clavos, pintura y mano de obra para su casa. Ha trabajado tres prestamos con ceprodel y estos han sido para su negocio el cual ha venido incrementando gracias a los financiamientos que ceprodel le ha brindado y este ultimo lo quiere para hacerle algunas mejoras a su casa de habitación.
texts.en:
Juana Evangelista H. has been an active merchant at the Mercado Oriental in Managua for 15 years.  She works Mondays through Saturdays from six in the morning until five in the afternoon.  She has four children.  Two of them are minors, and one is school age.  The others are grown and are no longer dependent upon her.  

The requested loan is to buy construction materials like zinc, purlins, nails, paint, and to pay for the labor for her house.  She has had three loans with Ceprodel.  These have been for her business, which has been growing thanks to the loans that Ceprodel provided for her.  She wants to use this loan to pay for some improvements to her house.

loans.use: To buy construction materials like zinc, purlins, nails, paint, and to pay for the labor for her house

loans.name: Marina Esperanza

texts.es:
Doña Marina, de 70 años de edad, es una persona emprendedora vive con sus dos hijos de 23 y 34 años de edad, residen en Quelepa departamento de San Miguel, ella es comerciante de ropa, cuadernos y útiles, trabaja de lunes a sábado, este negocio lo posee desde hace 23 años y lo tiene ubicado en el mercado municipal de Chinameca un lugar cerca de donde reside.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para comprar pantalones, camisas, jeans, cuadernos, lapiceros, y más artículos necesarios para los estudiantes, este préstamo le ayudara a su negocio para que en esta época de inicio de clases ella pueda ofrecer artículos escolares, también aumentara los estilos de ropa, con esta oportunidad de inversión espera mejorar su condición económica y poder administrar de la mejor manera los fondos.
La aspiración de ella es que este negocio cada día se vea más fortalecido y competente ya que de acá dependen los ingresos para su familia y para cubrir todos los gastos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Marina is 70 years old, an enterprising woman who lives with her two children who are 23 and 34 years old. They live in Quelepa, a department of San Miguel. She sells clothes, notebooks, and school supplies. She works Monday through Saturday. She has had the business for 23 years and it is located in the municipal market of Chinameca, a place close to where she lives.

She is requesting a loan to buy pants, shirts, jeans, notebooks, pens and other necessary articles for students. This loan will help her business because in this season, the students will start their classes and she will be able to offer more school supplies. She will also be able to increase the styles of clothing. With this investment opportunity, she hopes to improve her economic conditions and better utilize her funds. Her aspiration is that this business will continue to grow stronger and become more efficient since her family depends on its profits to cover all of their expenses.

loans.use: The purchase of pants, shirts, jeans, notebooks and pens.

loans.name: Rosalía

texts.es:
Rosalía es socia del Banco Comunal San Jose de Viñaca, tiene 27 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos. Rosalía se dedica la siembra y venta de verduras. Rosalía cuenta con terrenos donde siembra sus verduras, pero en las épocas donde sus verduras está en crecimiento se dedica a comprar de sus vecinas y los lleva al mercado Nery García Zarate y los reparte entre sus caseras. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de semillas y remedios. A Rosalía le gusta Finca porque le dan créditos y puede ahorrar.
Su sueño es que su negocio crezca y poder educar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Rosalía is a member of the San José de Viñaca communal bank. She is 27 years old, married, and has two children. She works planting and selling vegetables and has land where she plants them. However, during the seasons when her vegetables are growing, she buys from her neighbors and sells them at the Nery García Zarate market and distributes them among her regular customers. She will invest the loan requested in the purchase of seeds and medicines. Rosalía likes Finca because they give her loans and she can save.

Her dream is for her business to grow and to be able to educate her children.

loans.use: Purchase of seeds and medicines

loans.name: Mirla Lizeth

texts.es:
la señora Mirla Lizeth B. R. tiene 25 años de edad, esta casada con el señor Martir R. Romero quien trabaja en una empacadora de San Lorenzo y juntos salen adelante con su hijo.
Mirla vive en la aldea El Comercio, en estos momentos esta montando una pulperia en su casa de habitacion, tiene muy poco producto y es por esto que necesita el credito, va a comprar abarroteria para surtir un poco y empezar con su negocio, su meta es que para finales de este año tener bien establecida su pulperia en donde venda de todo y atender a los vecinos de su comunidad en todo lo ellos necesiten.
texts.en:
Mirla Lizeth B. R. is 25 years old and is married to Martir R. Romero, who works at a packing plant in San Lorenzo. Together, they get ahead with her son.

Mirla lives in the El Comercio village and at this time, she is setting up a grocery store in her house. She has few products and this is why she needs the loan. She will purchase groceries to start and stock her store a little. Her goal is at the end of this year, to have her grocery store well-established where she sells everything and tends to her neighbors in the community for whatever they need.

loans.use: Purchase of beans, rice, sugar, salt, coffee, bread, soap, cookies, drinks, churros

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Karla Nohemy

texts.es:
Karla es una joven de 21 años de edad, reside en Lolotique departamento de San Miguel, vive con su familia sus padres y hermanos, está soltera, ella administra un chalet en el centro escolar de Lolotique, donde vende a los estudiantes gaseosas, panes, pupusas, trabaja de lunes a viernes.
Ella necesita un préstamo para la compra de mercadería ya que se está próximo a iniciar el año educativo por lo que ella debe ir surtiendo el chalet de todos aquellos productos que a diario ofrecerá a los jóvenes estudiantes, su compra será en panes, pollo, gaseosas, boquitas, frutas, dulces, maíz entre muchos otros.
Con este préstamo espera iniciar un nuevo año lleno de bendiciones que su negocio sea prospero y pueda a través de las ganancias mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia, ayudar a su madre y también poder ella superarse y lograr sus sueños y aspiraciones dentro de su vida.
texts.en:
Karla is a 21-year-old young woman who lives with her parents and brothers in Lolotique, part of the department of San Miguel. She is single and manages a snack shop in the Lolotique school center where she sells soda, bread, and pupusas (a traditional Salvadoran dish) to the students from Monday to Friday.

She needs a loan for the purchase of merchandise since the school year begins soon. For this reason, she must stock her snack shop with all of the items that she sells daily to the young students. She will purchase breads, chicken, sodas, snacks, fruits, sweets, and corn, among many other items.

With this loan, she hopes to begin a new year full of blessings for her business to be prosperous and, through her earnings, for her to be able to improve her family’s living conditions, help her mother, and also to be able to succeed and achieve her dreams and aspirations during her life.

loans.use: Breads, chicken, sodas, snacks, fruits, sweets, corn

loans.name: Daria

texts.es:
Daría es socia del Banco Comunal San Jose de Viñaca, tiene 29 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos. Daría tiene una tienda de abarrotes en general, donde tambien vende verduras y frutas. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la comprar mercaderías como: arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceite, sal, leche, aguas gaseosas. a Daría le gusta las reuniones de su Banco Comunal por los créditos que le dan y porque puede ahorrar, le gusta las capacitaciones porque les enseñan que las mujeres y varones tienen los mismos derechos.
Su sueño es construir su casa y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Daría is a member of the San José de Viñaca communal bank. She is 29 years old, married, and has three children. She has a general grocery store where she also sells fruits and vegetables. She will invest the loan requested in the purchase of merchandise like rice, sugar, pasta, oil, salt, milk, and carbonated water. Daría likes the communal bank meetings because of the loans that they give and also because she can save. She likes the trainings because they teach them that women and men have the same rights.

Her dream is to build her house and for her children to be professionals.

loans.use: Purchase of rice, sugar, pasta, oil

loans.name: Ana Lucia

texts.es:
Ana Lucia, reside en Nueva Guadalupe departamento de San Miguel, tiene 30 años de edad, se dedica a vender ropa de forma ambulante, la familia de Ana Lucia está conformada por su madre, hermanos, dos hijos de las edades de 3 y 6 años, es madre soltera.
Ella inicia este negocio hace 7 años, trabajando de lunes a sábado, hasta el momento su negocio es estable y no ha tenido dificultades para comercializar sus prendas de vestir, pero para mantenerse siempre debe seguir fortaleciendo el negocio, y es con esta intención que solicita  un préstamo para comprar jeans, blusas, camisas, pantalones, short, y ropa interior, con esta inversión espera agradar a los clientes y llamar su atención para que puedan comprarle y generarle ganancias.
Ana Lucia está motivada a seguir trabajando para fortalecer cada día el negocio y proveer para sus hijos lo necesario y que estudien para superar sus vidas.
texts.en:
Ana Lucia lives in Nueva Guadalupe, part of the department of San Miguel. She is 30 years old and works selling clothing by foot. Ana Lucia’s family is comprised of her mother, siblings, and two children who are 3 and 6 years old. She is a single mother.

She started this business seven years ago, working Monday to Saturday. So far, her business has been stable and she hasn’t had any difficulties selling her clothing items. However, she must always continue strengthening her business in order to support herself and this is why she is requesting a loan to buy jeans, blouses, shirts, pants, shorts and underwear. With this loan, she hopes to please her clients and attract their attention so that they can buy from her and generate income for her.

Ana Lucia is motivated to continue working to strengthen her business every day, to provide her children with what they need, and for them to study to succeed in life.

loans.use: Purchase of jeans, blouses, shirts, pants, shorts, and underwear

loans.name: Kosar Sajid Ali's Group

texts.en:
Kosar lives in Kamoki, which is a small city in Punjab, Pakistan, famous for its agricultural industry. She lives in the area named Mor Amenabad in a two-roomed brick house with her brother. Her husband works abroad and she doesn’t have any children yet. Kosar is a talented lady who owns and operates a sewing business from her home. Her customer base is her neighborhood. She receives orders from her neighbors and earns a good income by completing them on time.
Kosar's brother operates a fruit-selling business. He sells fruit from his four-wheeled cart by going to different areas of the community. Kosar helps her brother by arranging the fruits on the cart so he sells them easily. Kosar has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, to expand her brother’s business. With the loan, he will buy fresh seasonal fruits for resale. He has been operating his business for the past 16 years and Kosar is confident that an investment will grow his business further. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. In her previous loan year, she established good credit behavior and never missed a meeting.
Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (an Asasah Passbook) is Kosar.

loans.use: To buy fresh seasonal fruits for fruit-selling business

loans.name: Frente Al Sol Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Frente al Sol” se ubica en el Municipio de Pinotepa Nacional, Oaxaca optó por éste nombre, por la ubicación del punto de encuentro de los que integran al grupo, la ubicación del lugar es en el negocio de la señora Claudia C. C.,  quien es la representante de sus compañeras. El lugar donde se reúnen está al descubierto y en las mañanas se puede apreciar el inicio de la mañana y del nuevo sol.
En esta narración hablaremos de Martha Iris Nicolás Ramírez, ella tiene 31 años de edad, es madre de 4 hijos y su esposo se dedica al oficio de albañil de 29 años de edad. Sus pequeños hijos se llaman: Denis de 13 años que estudia el 6to año de primaria, Axel de 11 quien cursa el 5to año, Irais de 8 y Jesús de 3 años. Martha se dedica a la venta y elaboración  de manualidades, actividad que inició desde hace mas de 1 año, esta actividad le ha permitido dedicarle mas tiempo a sus hijos, ya que antes ella era empleada en una tienda y esto no le permitía estar con sus hijos y atenderlos como ellos lo requerían, en el negocio de Martha se comercializan diversos artículos que son utilizados en fiestas infantiles y en diferentes eventos , ella vende piñatas, juguetes, ropa para bebé, recuerdos para fiestas y variedad de juguetes.
Martha  se integró a un grupo de crédito para solicitar un préstamo económico, el cual utilizará en la compra de mas artículos y materiales para su negocio, ella pudo adquirir piñatas, biberones, chupones, mordedoras, sonajas, gorritos, muñecas, carros de juguete, porta retratos, juego de té para niñas, figuras de acción, pañaleras, carriolas, pelotas y materiales para la elaboración de manualidades y recuerdos. El negocio de Marta marcha bien y en la temporada de diciembre sus ventas aumentaron mas, esto gracias a las tradicionales posadas que se realizan en la población, también el incremento de sus ventas se debió a la celebración de día de reyes  que por costumbre se adquieren juguetes para regalar a los niños, algunos artículos de Martha son de temporada y es por eso que su mercancía varia de acuerdo a las necesidades de la gente.
Las ganancias obtenidas en el negocio de Martha están destinadas para la adquisición de mas mercancía, también para liquidar su crédito, poco a poco su negocio ha ido creciendo, y mejorado.
Uno de sus grandes sueños de Martha es hacer crecer su negocio, mejorarlo en todos los aspectos en tener mercancía, en integrar alguna persona que le ayude en la atención a los clientes. También  desearía tener su casa propia, ya que por el momento ella vive con sus suegros.
La esperanza de Martha son sus hijos en ellos deposita sus sueños y anhelos, ella espera algún día verlos como personas de bien, seres humanos buenos que ayuden a su prójimo que no tengan que carecer de lo necesario en la vida, ella desea que sus niños  se preparen que crezcan llenos de amor y cariño, lo primordial para que se puedan desarrollar en un ambiente de salud, de armonía.
Gracias a kiva  por ser un espacio donde los seños pensados pueden ser hechos realidad, porque gracias a instituciones como Fundacion realidad los que menos tienen son los que reciben este gran gesto de apoyo y servicio, las mujeres de la costa de Oaxaca se sienten respaldadas por este gran equipo.
El grupo “Frente al sol”, se  integra por un número de 10 mujeres, que dedican su esfuerzo y tiempo en forjar un futuro mejor para sus hijos, ellas son mujeres responsables y trabajadoras de gran compromiso con sus familias y con la sociedad. Estos son los nombres de las personas que integran al grupo así como su actividad personal de cada integrante.

Claudia C. C..-Venta de comida económica y antojitos
Patricia Ramírez Hernández.- Venta de zapatos por catalogo
Trinidad Ramírez.- Venta de Ropa
Laura Licex Baños C..- Venta de dulces
Miriam Ramírez García.- Elaboración y venta de antojitos
Lucia N. A..- Venta de pescado
Ana Rocío Ramírez Hernández.- Venta de perfumería
Martha Iris Nicolás Ramírez.- Bisutería y venta de artículos de fiesta
Alberta Eugenia S. M..- Elaboración y venta de antojitos
Nereyda Patricia Pérez B..- Venta de ropa
texts.en:
The "Frente al Sol" group is from the town of Pinotepa Nacional, Oaxaca.  The name comes from the actual place where the members of  the group meet, which happens to be the business site belonging to Mrs. Claudia C. C., who acts as the representative for her colleagues.  The meetings take place outside where the rising sun can be seen every morning.

In this narrative we will talk about Martha Iris Nicolás Ramírez who is 31 years old and the mother of four children.  Her husband is 29 years old and is a bricklayer.  Her small children are Denis, who is 13 years old and in the 6th grade, Axel who is 11 and in 5th grade, Irais who is 8 and Jesús who is 3 years old.  Martha has been making and selling crafts for over a year.  Before she worked in a store and didn't have enough time to look after her children the way she wanted to but with her current job she can.  Martha sells all kinds of articles for children's parties and events.  She sells piñatas, toys, baby clothes and souvenirs.

Martha became a member of the group so she could request a loan to buy more items and materials for her business, such as piñatas, baby bottles, pacifiers, rattles, baby caps, dolls, doll buggies, photo frames, tea sets for little girls, action figures, diaper bags, balls and materials for handicrafts and souvenirs.  Martha's business is doing well and sales increased in December thanks to the traditional nativity scenes and celebrations carried out in the town.  Also there was more activity around the Epiphany dates as parents were buying toys for children.  Martha usually stocks her business depending on the season and on customer demand.

Martha uses her earnings to buy more goods and to pay back her loan.  Her business has improved greatly.

One of Martha's big dreams is to expand her business, make improvements in merchandise, and hire someone to help her out with customer service.  She also wants to buy her own home since she now lives with her in-laws.

Martha hopes to see her children grow into good citizens who help others in need.  She wants to see them happy and nurtured in love and affection, growing up in a healthy, harmonious atmosphere.

Thanks to Kiva these dreams can come true; and thanks to institutions like the Foundation, those who have less can receive a gesture of support and service.  The women from the Oaxaca coast feel supported by this great team.

The "Frente al sol" group is comprised of 10 ladies who work very hard to carve out a future for their children.  They are responsible, hard-working women who are very committed to their families and society.  These are the names of each member of the group and their individual activity.

Claudia C. C..- Sells fast food and snacks  
Patricia Ramírez Hernández.- Sells shoes by catalogue   
Trinidad Ramírez.- Sells clothing
Laura Licex Baños C..- Sells sweets
Miriam Ramírez García.- Makes and sells snacks
Lucia N. A..- Sell fish
Ana Rocío Ramírez Hernández.- Sells perfume
Martha Iris Nicolás Ramírez.- Sells costume jewelry and party supplies
Alberta Eugenia S. M..- Makes and sells snacks
Nereyda Patricia Pérez B..- Sells clothing

loans.use: To buy piñatas, balls, dolls, doll buggies, baby bottles, pacifiers, caps, photo frames, diaper bags, lipstick, nail polish, hairpieces, rattles, action figures and materials for handicrafts and souvenirs

loans.name: Manantial Group

texts.es:
La Banca Comunal “MANANTIAL” es un grupo de 7 mujeres y un varón que han decidido unirse para recibir crédito, capacitación y atención en salud,  es parte del centro focal de Santiago II, ellas están iniciando su primer ciclo.
Cada una de las socias tiene negocio propio, de servicio, producción o comercio. Entre ellos tenemos:   venta de comida, venta de cortinas, venta de juguetes, chofer, peluquería, venta de frutas.
Para su organización, la B. C. Manantial cuenta con una mesa directiva integrada por una presidenta, la señora  Marina, una tesorera, la señora  Guadalupe y una secretaria de actas, la señora  Karem.
 
La Presidenta, la señora  Marina está casada, tiene un hijo.    El negocio de la señora  Marina se encuentra en su propio domicilio y consiste en la venta de comida.   La pensión fue herencia de su mamá.  El préstamo solicitado fue por Bs.2000.- y será destinado para la ampliación del negocio.

La señora presidenta nunca había sido socia de Pro Mujer, esta es su primera experiencia,  cuando se le consulta que es lo que le atrae de la institución, ella responde “el crédito”.
texts.en:
The "MANANTIAL" communal bank is a group of seven women and one man who have decided to unite in order to request a loan and receive training and healthcare.  They are  beginning their first year at the Santiago II focal center.

Each one of the members has their own business, be it service, production or trade.  These include: food sales, curtain sales, toy sales, driver services, hair salon, and fruit sales.

The Manantial communal bank has a board of directors with a president, Mrs. Marina, a treasurer, Mrs. Guadalupe and a secretary, Mrs. Karem.

The president, Mrs. Marina is married and has a son.  Her business is operated out of her home and involves food sales. She inherited her pension from her mother.  The amount of the loan is Bs. 2000 which will be used to expand business.
 
The president had never been a member of Pro Mujer (Pro Woman) so this is her first experience.  She was drawn to the institution because of the loan services.

loans.use: To extend pension terms

loans.name: Maria Cecilia

texts.es:
Maria Cecilia F. C. tiene 50 años. Es Soltera, vive con los hijos en el cantón  Ventanas en la Provincia de los ríos.  Tiene 2 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. ESFUERZO Y TRABAJO  se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Campos Grandes perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Maria Cecilia se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz desde hace 2 años. Compra sus productos en Agripac, y  vende en la feria en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz, arroz. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar un terreno.

Le gusta la lectura.
texts.en:
Maria Cecilia F. C. is 50. She is single and lives with her children in the Ventanas Canton, Los Rios Province. She has 2 children.

The members of the V.R.C. Esfuerzo y Trabajo ["Effort and Work"] are located in the Campos Grandes neighbourhood belonging to the Pueblo Viejo Canton. The members of this bank have long worked in short-cycle agricultural labour, sowing corn and rice.

Maria Cecilia has worked in agriculture, sowing corn and rice, for two years. She buys her products in Agripac and sells them in the market in the same area.

She is requesting this loan to purchase agricultural tools and fertilizers for cultivating corn and rice. In supporting this loan, you will help her economically to supply her needs. She confronts challenges such as plagues, diseases and the varied climate. Her dream is to buy a plot of land.

She enjoys reading.

loans.use: the purchase of agricultural inputs and fertilizers

loans.name: Erika Marjori

texts.es:
Erika de 27 años de edad, reside en San Francisco Gotera, departamento de Morazán, ella alquila vivienda junto a su esposo y cuatro hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de forma ambulante, los días de venta son de lunes a domingo y lo hace en los cantones de las afueras de San Francisco Gotera, es un trabajo que requiere sacrificio ya que debe desplazarse hasta lugares en donde es difícil el transporte, pero esta es la fuente de ingreso con la que cuenta para ayudar a su esposo y poder juntos mantener el hogar y en principal a sus hijos.
Ella esta solicitando un préstamo para la compra de ropa de niños y femenina para ofrecer a los clientes, con esta compra contara con más prendas de vestir para ofrecer y aumentar sus posibilidades de venta y de ganar ingresos para su familia.
Su sueño es que algún día puede tener casa propia, mejorar sus condiciones económicas y que sus hijos tengan lo necesario para tener un sano crecimiento así como la oportunidad de asistir a la escuela y terminar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Erika is 27 years old and lives with her husband and four children in San Francisco Gotera, in the departmment of Morazán.  She sells clothing, Monday through Sunday, in the cantons on the outskirts of San Francisco Gotera.  It is very hard work since she has to travel to hard-to-reach places.  This is the only way she can help her husband and provide an income for the household and for her children.

She plans to use the loan to buy children's and women's clothing.  She wants to offer more variety to customers to increase sales and income.

Her dream is to one day buy her own home, improve her money situation and provide the best for her children so they can grow up in a healthy atmosphere and have the opportunity to attend school and finish their studies.

loans.use: To buy children's and women's clothing

loans.name: Maria Aracelis

texts.es:
la sra, Maria G. tiene 49 años de edad, esta casada y no dependen hijos de ella, todos sus hijos ya formaron sus propios hogares.
Maria vive en el barrio Morazan de la ciudad de San Lorenzo y se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tiene una pulperia en su casa de habitacion, ahi vende frijoles, arroz, azucar, cafe, pan, lacteos, etc. a logrado tener muchos clientes. 
dice sentirse contenta ya que su negocio cada dia crece mas, pero su meta es tener un negocio grande con mucha variedad de productos.
las ganancias las necesita para cubrir los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria G. is 49 years old and married.  All of her children are independent and have their own homes.  Maria lives in the Morazan quarter in the city of San Lorenzo.  Out of her home she runs a grocery store where she sells beans, rice, coffe, bread, dairy products, etc., to an extensive customer base.

She is happy with her businness and says that it is growing on a daily basis.  Her goal is to offer a variety of products.  Her earnings are used to cover household expenses.

loans.use: To buy toilet tissue, candles, matches, lightbulbs, batteries, razors, soap, toothpaste, rice, sugar, beans, margarine, soup, pasta, cookies, condiments, vegetables, oil, cereal

loans.name: Amelia Sabrina

texts.es:
Amelia Sabrina V. F. tiene 28 años. Vive en Unión Libre, vive con el compañero y con los hijos, vive en el cantón  Ventanas en la Provincia de los ríos. Tiene 5 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. ESFUERZO Y TRABAJO  se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Campos Grandes perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es llegar a comprar una casa.

Le gusta bailar.
texts.en:

The members of the V.R.C. Esfuerzo y Trabajo ["Effort and Work"] are located in the Campos Grandes neighbourhood belonging to the Pueblo Viejo Canton. The members of this bank have long worked in short-cycle agricultural labour, sowing corn and rice.

Amelia Sabrina has worked in agriculture, sowing corn and rice, for two years. She buys her products in Agripac and sells them in the market in the same area.

She is requesting this loan to purchase agricultural tools and fertilizers for cultivating corn and rice. In supporting this loan, you will help her economically to supply her needs. She confronts challenges such as plagues, diseases and the varied climate. Her dream is to buy a house.

She enjoys dancing.

loans.use: the purchase of agricultural tools and fertilizers

loans.name: Paz Y Amor Group

texts.es: Ynes es socia del Banco Comunal Paz y Amor, que empieza su ciclo 18 con 20 socias, Ynes es la Presidenta del Banco Comunal, tiene 28 años y 2 hijos D. 11 y 8 años D. edad. Ynes se dedica a la venta D. comida los sábados y domingos en el Campo deportivo D. Huayllapampa y los demás días D. la semana en su casa, también venD. aguas gaseosas y bebidas. Solicita un préstamo para invertir en la compra D. insumos para la preparación D. alimentos. A Ynes le gusta las reuniones D. Su Banco comunal porque le hablan D. sus derechos y como trabajar, le gusta ahorrar. Su sueño es que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Ynes is a member of the Paz y Amor communal bank which is beginning its 18th year with 20 members.  Ynes is the president of the bank and is 28 years old with two children, ages 11 and 8.

On Saturdays and Sundays Ynes sells food at the Huayllapamnpa sports field and the rest of the week she works out of her home selling soft drinks and other beverages.

She is requesting the loan to buy ingredients for her food sales.  Ynes likes the meetings at the communal bank because she learns about her rights and how to work.  She likes to save her money.  Her dream is for her children to have professional careers.

loans.use: To buy rice, oil and food ingredients

loans.name: Trinidad Teresa

texts.es:
Trinidad Teresa A. M. tiene 48 años. Es Soltera, vive con los hijos en el cantón  Ventanas en la Provincia de los ríos.  Tiene 4 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. ESFUERZO Y TRABAJO  se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Campos Grandes perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Trinidad Teresa se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz desde hace 3 años. Compra sus productos en Agripac, y  vende en la feria en el mismo recinto.

Le gusta la música.

Trinidad Teresa has worked in agriculture, sowing corn and rice, for three years. She buys her products in Agripac and sells them in the market in the same area.

She is requesting this loan to purchase agricultural tools and fertilizers for cultivating corn and rice. In supporting this loan, you will help her economically to supply her needs. She confronts challenges such as plagues, diseases and the varied climate. Her dream is to buy a house.

She enjoys music.

loans.use: the purchase of agricultural inputs and fertilizers

She confronts challenges such as plagues, diseases and the varied climate. Her dream is to give her children a good education.

She enjoys dancing.

loans.use: the purchase of agricultural tools and fertilizers

loans.name: Carlos Ismael

texts.es:
Carlos Ismael M. P. tiene 42 años de edad. Es casado vive con la esposa en el cantón  Ventanas en la Provincia de los ríos.  Tiene 3 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. ESFUERZO Y TRABAJO  se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Campos Grandes perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Carlos Ismael se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz desde hace 3 años. Compra sus productos en Agripac, y  vende en la feria en el mismo recinto.

Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar una maquinaria agrícola.

Le gusta bailar.
texts.en:
Carlos Ismael M. P. is 42. He is married and lives with his wife in the Ventanas Canton, Los Rios Province. He has three children.

The members of the V.R.C. Esfuerzo y Trabajo ["Effort and Work"] are located in the Campos Grandes neighbourhood belonging to the Pueblo Viejo Canton. The members of this bank have long worked in short-cycle agricultural labour, sowing corn and rice.

Carlos Ismael has worked in agriculture, sowing corn and rice, for three years. He buys his products in Agripac and sells them in the market in the same area.

He is requesting this loan to purchase agricultural tools and fertilizers for cultivating corn and rice. In supporting this loan, you will help him economically to supply his needs. He confronts challenges such as plagues, diseases and the varied climate. His dream is to buy a farm machine.

He enjoys dancing.

loans.use: agricultural tools and fertilizers

loans.name: Paula Marina

texts.es:
Paula es socia del Banco Comunal Color Esperanza, tiene 35 años, es  conviviente y tiene 3 hijos.
Paula es feriante. Paula compra papa al por mayor en el Mercado de las Americas y Santa Elena y lo lleva por flete a Lima al Mercado de la Parada ahí lo vende, ahora que es temporada de papa, realiza ésta operación casi diario y las épocas que no hay papa se dedica a la venta de cereales. Solciita un préstamo para invertir en la compra de papas. A Paula le gusta Finca porque le dan créditos y puede ahorrar.
Su sueño es poder juntar un capital y poder abrir un restaurante para poder estar mas tiempo con su hijos y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Paula is a member of the communal bank named "The color of hope". She is 35 years old, she lives with her common-law partner and she has 3 children. 

Paula is a merchant. She purchases potatoes in wholesale in the market named Mercado de la Americans and in the market of Santa Elena. She transports the products to Lima's market "Mercado la Parada" where she makes her sales. Right now potatoes are in season and she makes these trips almost daily. When potatoes are not in season she sells cereal grains. She requests a loan to invest in the purchase of potatoes. Paula appreciates Finca (Kiva Field Partner) because they grant her loans and she is able to save money. 

Her dream is to save enough funds to set up a restaurant. She will be able to spend more time with her children and to see them grow up to have careers.

loans.use: To purchase potatoes.

loans.name: Urania Guadalupe

texts.es:
La Sra. Urania Guadalupe González, trabaja como secretaria para el centro de insumos para la salud, es madre de tres hijos, pero solo uno depende de ella y este se encuentra en edad escolar.
Ha trabajado tres préstamos con ceprodel y estos han sido para el mejoramiento de su vivienda.
Ella acude nuevamente a ceprodel para solicitar un nuevo financiamiento para la compra de materiales  de construcción para hacer un cuarto para su hijo menor.
Ella se siente muy agradecida con ceprodel ya que ahora su vivienda cuenta con mejores condiciones gracias a los financiamientos otorgados por ceprodel.
texts.en:
Urania Guadalupe Gonzalez works as a secretary in a health supply centre. She is mother of three children, but only one is still dependent on her as he is still school aged.

He has had previous loans through Ceprodel (Kiva Field Partner) and they were invested to improve her home. She requests a new loan from Ceprodel to purchase construction materials to build a bedroom for her youngest son. 

She is very grateful to Ceprodel because her home is in a better state now, thanks to the loans they granted her.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials to build a bedroom.

loans.name: Maria Francisca

texts.es:
la señora Maria Francisca A. E. tiene 32 años de edad, esta casada con el señor Fredy Alexi Maldonado, viven en el barrio Morazan de la ciudad de Nacaome.
Maria se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva en el mercado municipal de Langue,  tambien vende cosmeticos.
juntos con su esposo cubren los gastos del hogar.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de ropa nueva americana y cosmeticos.
las ganancias las necesita para cubrir los gastos del hogar y salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Maria Francisca A. E. is 32 years old, she is married with Fredy Alexi Maldonado and they live together in the district of Morazan, in the city of Nacaome. 

Maria sells new clothing in the municipal market of Langue. She also sells cosmetics. 

Together with her husband they are able to cover the household expenses. 

The loan will be used to purchase new Americana brand clothing and cosmetics. 

She needs these earning to cover the household expenses and to support her family.

loans.use: To purchase new clothing and cosmetics.

loans.name: Bertha Isabel

texts.es:
Bertha Isabel L. G. tiene 43 años. Es casada vive con la esposo en el cantón  Ventanas en la Provincia de los ríos.  Tiene 3 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. ESFUERZO Y TRABAJO  se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Campos Grandes perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Bertha Isabel se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz desde hace 3 años. Compra sus productos en Agripac, y  vende en la feria en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz, arroz. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar una casa.

Le gusta bailar.
texts.en:
Bertha Isabel L. G. is 43. She is married and lives with her husband in the Ventanas Canton, Los Rios Province. She has 3 children.

The members of the V.R.C. Esfuerzo y Trabajo ["Effort and Work"] are located in the Campos Grandes neighbourhood belonging to the Pueblo Viejo Canton. The members of this bank have long worked in short-cycle agricultural labour, sowing corn and rice.

Bertha Isabel has worked in agriculture, sowing corn and rice, for three years. She buys her products in Agripac and sells them in the market in the same area.

She is requesting this loan to purchase agricultural tools and fertilizers for cultivating corn and rice. In supporting this loan, you will help her economically to supply her needs. She confronts challenges such as plagues, diseases and the varied climate. Her dream is to buy a house.

She enjoys dancing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay farmhands

loans.name: Teofila

texts.es: Teofila es social del Banco Comunal Color Esperanza, tiene 62 años, es viuda y tiene 7 hijos. Teofila  compra papa del mercado Las Americas, Santa Elena y lo lleva a Lima al Mercado de la Parada, cuando es su temporada casi ínter diario y cuando no es temporada se dedica a la venta de tuna, tara, etc. Le gusta las reuniones de su Banco Comunal por los créditos que le otorgan y porque puede ahorrar. Teofila solicita un prestamo para invertir en la compara de papa. Su sueño es que su negocio crezca y que sus hijos tengan sus propios negocios.
texts.en: Teofila is a member of the "Color Esperanza" ("Colour of Hope") communal bank. She is 62 years old, a widow with 7 children. Teofila buys potatoes at the Las Americas market in Santa Elena and takes them to the La Parada market in Lima. When they are in season she does this almost every other day, and out of season she sells tuna, tara leaves, etc. She likes the communal bank meetings because they enable access to credit and allow her to save. Teofila isseeking a loan to invest in buying potatoes. Her dream is to grow her business - and that her children will have their own businesses one day.

loans.use: To buy potatoes

loans.name: Jose Eliseo

texts.es:
Don José, es un señor de 56 años de edad, su lugar de residencia es en San Francisco Gotera, departamento de Morazán, ahí vive con su esposa, 5 hijos y un nieto, don  José se dedica a la crianza de pollos, este negocio consiste en comprar los pollos pequeños y alimentarlos por ocho semanas dándoles vitaminas, antibióticos y alimento para que crezcan y engorden en este periodo, luego se comercializan.
Don José necesita construir una galera para los pollos y solicita un préstamo para poder comprar los materiales como laminas, madera y maya, este crédito le ayudara a mejorar las instalaciones de la granja para que tengan un lugar amplio y puedan crecer en mejores condiciones.
La aspiración de él es conseguir que este negocio sea viable a largo plazo que le produzca ganancias mejores para su hogar.
texts.en: Don José is a 56 year old man who resides in San Francisco Gotera, in the Department of Morazán. He lives with his wife, 5 children and 1 grandson. Don José makes his living raising poultry. He buys young chicks and feeds them up over 8 weeks, giving them vitamins, antibiotics and food, so that they grow and fatten well, and then he sells them. Don José needs to build a hen-house, and is seeking a loan to be able to buy materials, such as metal sheeting and wood, for the project. This loan will help him improve the enclosures at his farm, so that the chickens have ample space and can grow up in better conditions. He aspires to continue with his business so that it is viable over the long term and generates better income for his household.

loans.use: To buy sheeting, wood and other materials to build farm enclosures.

loans.name: Khalida Muhammad Rafiq's Group

texts.en:
Khalida lives in Kamoki, a small city in Punjab, Pakistan, known for its agricultural industry. She lives there with her family in the area named Mor Amenabad in a two-roomed brick house. Khalida is 45 years old and married to M. R.. She has a 22-year-old son. Her husband operates a construction supplies business and his son also helps in this business. Khalida's husband has run this business for over 20 years and is well known due to the quality of his items and his good manner with customers.
Khalida herself is a talented lady who shares the financial burden with her husband by running an embroidery business. She has a number of customers in the neighboring areas who give her regular orders and she earns a good income by completing them on time. Khalida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy construction supplies such as cement, bricks, sand etc. in bulk, which will help meet customers' needs and earn extra income.
Khalida is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. In her previous loan year, she paid her installments on time and never missed a single meeting.
Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (an Asasah Passbook) is Khalida.

loans.use: To buy construction supplies for resale

loans.name: Maria Isbel

texts.es:
La señora Maria Isabel G. ya ha tenido tres créditos con Kiva los cuales han sido para pagos escolares de sus hijos.
Doña Maria Isabel esta nuevamente solicitando un préstamo para pagar la inscripción de la escuela, ya que no cuenta con el dinero necesario y no le admiten a su niños si no esta pagado. 
 Planea pagar el crédito con el ingreso que obtiene de su trabajo como empleada de una maquiladora en el departamento de producción.
Ya que su esposo el señor Clemente Delgado se encargara de los gastos familiares, de su trabajo como constructor.
texts.en: Señora Maria Isabel G. has had three previous loans with Kiva, which have been to cover school fees for her children. Maria Isabel is now seeking a new loan to cover the enrolment fee, because she doesn't have enough money available and they will not let her children attend until it is paid. She plans to repay the loan with the income she makes from her job as a factory worker. Her husband, Señor Clemente Delgado, takes charge of the other household costs, through his job as a construction worker.

loans.use: School expenses for their children

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Elvis Roberto

texts.es:
El Sr. Elvis R. J. tiene 25 años de edad, vive en la colonia Abrahan Zuniga en la ciudad de Nacaome.
Elvis se dedica a prestar el servicio de cambio de aceite a motocicletas, tiene poco tiempo de haber iniciado con su negocio en el cual le esta llendo muy bien.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de cajas de aceite ya que asi es mas barato el aceite y puede obtener mejores ganancias las cuales las necesita para cubrir los gastos del hogar.
dice sentirse feliz ya que tiene negocio propio y siente que cada dia lo visitan mas personas para que les haga el cambio de aceite a sus motocicletas, en un futuro si tiene muchos clientes piensa contratar a alguien para cubrir con todas las necesidades de sus clientes.
texts.en: Señor Elvis R. J. is 25 years old and lives in the Abrahan Zuniga district in the city of Nacaome. Elvis dedicates himself to providing a service, changing oil in motorcycles. He started his business not so long ago, and it is going well. The loan will be used to buy large cans of oil, because it is cheaper to buy it in bulk and he can make a greater profit, which he needs to cover his household expenses. He says he is happy, because he has his own business and feels that every day more customers come to have the oil changed in their motorcycles. In future, if he has enough customers, he hopes to hire someone else to work with him, so that he can meet all the customers' needs.

loans.use: To buy cans of motor oil

loans.name: Ofelia Piedad

texts.es:
Ofelia Piedad C. M. tiene 52 años de edad, Vive en Unión Libre con el compañero y con los hijos en el Cantón ventanas Provincia de los Ríos, Tiene un hijo.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. 26 DE NOVIEMBRE  se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Las blancas Perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas Esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.
