She prepares breakfasts and lunches in the back part of one of the vehicles used for public service. She works from 6am to 5pm and she wants to have a restaurant. She is requesting the loan to purchase items to cook such as chicken, meat, and vegetables.

Dolores is happy because of the loan and promises to make her loan payments.

loans.use: To purchase items to cook such as chicken, meat, and vegetables

loans.name: María Ermelinda

texts.es:
La Señora María B. es socia del banco comunal Zhidmad, vive en la comunidad de Pitcadeleg que le pertenece a la parroquia de Zhidmad, hay una gran vista de la naturaleza, su gente se dedica a la cría de animales, a la agricultura y también mucha de su población sale a la ciudad en busca de un mejor trabajo.

Doña María se dedica a la cría de ganado, con la leche que obtiene de su ganado realiza quesillo para la venta, también tiene cerdos y gallinas las que vende en su comunidad.

La Señora. María tiene 60 años, es casada y tiene 6 hijos quienes son mayores de edad,  casados e independientes. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, con el esfuerzo y trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.

Es una socia fundadora del banco comunal y este su crédito 17, el cual lo va a invertir en la compra de cerdos para la cría. Su sueño es mejorar su casa ya que esta un poco deteriorada por el paso del tiempo.
texts.en:
Mrs. María B. is a member of the Zhidmad Communal Bank. She lives in the community of Pitcadeleg which belongs to the parish of Zhidmad. They have a great view of nature. The people of this community raise animals and farm. A lot of its population leaves for the city in search of a better job.

María works raising cattle and she makes cheese to sell with the milk she obtains from them. She also has pigs and chickens that she sells in the community.

María is 60 years old, married, and has six children who are adults, married, and independent. Her husband works in farming and with their effort and work, they were able to build their own house.

She is a founding member of the communal bank and this is her 17th loan, which she will invest in the purchase of pigs to raise. Her dream is to improve her house as it is slightly deteriorated from the passing of time.

loans.use: To purchase pigs

loans.name: Maria Isabel Reyna

texts.es: Maria Isabel Reyna H. M., tiene 47 años, es casada, tiene 9 hijos, y reside en la comunidad de la Abisinia a 16 kilometros de la ciudade de Tocoa, Colon. Tiempo atras Maria y su esposo se dedicaban a la venta de leche hasta que FAMA les brindò su primer prestamo. Dicho prestamo fue invirtido en la compra de medicina natural y ahora ella se dedica a venderlas en su domicilio. En la aldea donde vive Maria no hay otro negocio igual que el de ella asi que eso le garantiza la clientela total. El prestamo que actualmente solicita lo necesita para comprar vitaminas, jeringas, desparasitadores, panadol, iboprodol, etc y asi surtir mas su pequeño negocio. Con el apoyo del prestamo Maria mantendrà una entrada de dinero que le permite ayudar a su esposo a sostener la familia. Su sueño apoyar a sus dos hijas menores con el estudio para que ellas se graduen y tengan una mejor oportunidad de vida. Ha sido cliente por cuatro ciclos y ha demostrado responsabilidad en el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en: Maria Isabel is 47 years old, married and has nine children. She lives in the community of Abisinia, 16 kilometers from the city of Tocoa, Colon. Previously Maria and her husband sold milk until FAMA provided them with their first loan. This loan was used to buy natural medicine. She currently sells this medicine from her house. In the area where she is located, there is not another business like hers, so she has a guaranteed clientele. With the money from the loan that she is requesting she will buy vitamins, syringes, medicine to remove parasites, acetaminophen, ibuprofen, etc. In this way she will provide a larger variety of products for her small business. With the help of this loan, Maria will be able to assist her husband with the support of their family. Her dream is to help her younger children with their education so that they graduate and have a better opportunity in life. She has had four loans and has always paid her payments responsibly

loans.use: She will buy vitamins, syringes, medicine to kill parasites, acetaminophen, ibuprofen.

loans.name: Amigos Del  Milenio Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “Amigos del  Milenio” tiene 13 ciclos D. funcionamiento (cada ciclo son 4 meses),  el banco comunal está conformado por 10 mujeres y 2 varones. Las reuniones del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la oficina central D. la Asociación Arariwa D. la ciudad del Cusco. La mayoría D. los socios viven en los diferentes distritos D. la ciudad del Cusco. 

Los socios son trabajadores y emprendedores que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos.  Las actividades económicas D. algunos D. los socios a las que se dedican son por ejemplo; venta D. verduras, venta D. condimentos, venta D. pasamanería y venta D. comestibles. Otros socios se dedican a brindar servicios D. café D. internet, contabilidad, empleada D. una tienda D. imprenta y analista D. créditos.  

La socia Bertha, tiene 53 años y está casada.  Actualmente,  Bertha  vive junto con su esposo  y sus tres hijos en el populoso distrito D. San Sebastián. Su actividad económica principal D. Bertha es la venta D. comestibles, ella venD. sus productos en su propia tienda que está ubicada en su domicilio, se la pueD. encontrar a la socia en su negocio D. lunes a domingo desD. las 6 D. la mañana hasta las 9 D. la noche. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien.  Bertha va invertir el préstamo en el capital del negocio y desea comprar más mercadería como por ejemplo arroz, fideos, leche, azúcar y muchas cosas más.
texts.en:
The comunal bank, "Amigos del Milenio" (Friends of the Millenium) has 13 working cycles ( each cycle is 4 months); the comunal bank is maD. up of 10 women and 2 males.  The group meets every 30 days at the central offices of the Arariwa Association in the city of Cusco.  Most of the group's members live in the various districts of Cusco.

The members are hard-working and entrepreneurial and are searching for opportunities to get ahead and with their daily efforts be able to proviD. a better future to their children.  As an example, some of the business activites of the members are: selling vegetables, snacks, ornaments, and groceries.  Other members proviD. services such as: internet cafes, accountancy, credit analysts, and an employee at a print shop.

Bertha is a member, she is 53 years old, married and lives with her husband and 3 children in the San Sebastian district.  Bertha's primary business activity is selling groceries and she does so from her own store located at her residence. She has been in the business several years with success and can be found at her place of business, Monday-Sunday from 6AM until 9PM.  Bertha will be utilizing the loan as working capital for the business and wants to purchase goods such as; rice, noodles, milk, sugar, and much more.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise such as: rice, noodles, milk, sugar, and much more.

loans.name: Rafael Alberto

texts.es:
Don Rafael R. es trabajador del Centro de Capacitación Profesional Nicaragüense Alemán CECNA, desde hace 4 años, desempeñando el cargo de Instructor de Artes Gráficas.
Es casado con dos personas a cargo su esposa que estudia y su hijo en edad escolar.
Este es el segundo crédito con CEPRODEL los que ha invertido en Gastos Médico, gastos personales y la mejora de su casa.
Agradece a CEPRODEL por brindarle la oportunidad de mejorar su vivienda
texts.en:
Rafael has been a worker at the Centro de Capacitacion Profesional Nicaraguense Aleman (Aleman Center for Nicaraguan Professional Training), CECNA, for some 4 years, serving as an  Instructor in Graphic Arts.

He is married with the responsibility for 2 additional people, his wife, who is studying, and his school-age son.

This is Rafael's 2nd loan with CEPRODEL. So far, he has invested in medical and personal costs, and in home improvements.

Rafael is grateful to CEPRODEL for offering the opportunity to improve his residence.

loans.use: FOR HOME IMPROVEMENT: BUYING CONSTRUCTION MATERIALS TO BUILD A PERIMETER WALL

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
A L. vivienda D. L. señora Francisca D. L. R., le esta haciendo falta L. barda alrededor D. L. casa. 
Solicita el préstamo para poder comprar el material que necesita y pagarle a L. persona que se encargara D. realizar L. mejora y que por el momento no cuenta  con el dinero necesario para realizar L. mejora. 
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte del ingreso que obtiene como empleada domestica D. una casa particular, ya que tiene tres hijos bajo su responsabilidad. 
Doña Francisca desea L. seguridad y L. protección  D. su familia es por eso que solicita su cooperación para este crédito.
texts.en:
The home of Francisca D. L. R. is missing a fence around the house. 
She is requesting the loan so that she can buy the material that she needs and pay the person who is seeing to the improvement and at the moment she does not have the money necessary to get the improvement done. 
She plans to pay off the loan with part of the income that she earns doing housework at a particular house, as she has three children under her care. 
Francisca wishes for the security and protection of her family and this is why she is requesting your cooperation for this loan.

loans.use: Building of a fence around the house

loans.name: Léster Alfonso

texts.es:
El señor Léster Alfonso P. V. es conductor de Transporte Liviano en la Empresa Nicaragüense de Acueductos y Alcantarillado ENACAL desde hace 10 años.

El es casado con una persona a su cargo solamente su esposa. Es el primer crédito que trabaja en CEPRODEL, lo necesita para comprar una moto y poder transportarse más rápido y más barato a su centro de trabajo.
texts.en:
Léster has been Light Transport Vehicle driver for 10 years for ENACAL, a Nicaraguan Water and Sewage company.
He is married and has no children. 

This is his first loan with CEPRODEL. He is requesting the loan to buy a motorcycle so that he can commute to work quicker and more economically.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: María De Lourdes

texts.es:
La señora María de Lourdes M., trabaja en la Universidad Nacional de Ingeniería (UNI), ubicada en la oficina de servicios administrativos, tiene 18 años de laborar como cocinera.
Es casada madre de dos hijos que todavía estudian, ella ya ha pagado 6 créditos en CEPRODEL, los que han pagado puntualmente, los ha utilizado para construcción de su vivienda. Este crédito lo quiere para construir una parte de su vivienda
texts.en: Mrs. María de Lourdes M. works at the National University of Engineering, in the office of administrative services.  She has worked as a cook for 18 years.  Mrs. M. is married with two children, who currently attend school.  She has already punctually paid off 6 loans with CEPRODEL.  She has used the loans to construct her home.  She is requesting another loan to continue the construction of her home.

loans.use: Home Construction

loans.name: María Josefa

texts.es:
En la ciudadela San Eduardo, de la ciudad de Portoviejo, se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Parque Ecológico, este lugar es conocido porque aquí hay un hermoso parque el cual es muy visitado por los turistas y personas de la localidad que quieren pasar un dia en contacto con la naturaleza.

Aquí encontramos a la señora María, ella está en  el Banco Comunal desde el inicio  hace dos ciclos ya que este es un Banco nuevo y dice que está muy a gusto porque ha recibido muchos beneficios de parte de la Fundación Espoir para sacar su negocio adelante. Tiene 28 años, está divorciada y tiene un hijo de 3 años, ella tiene un titulo de Lic. En enfermería.

Se dedica a la venta productos por Avon, (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas). Además de ropa por catalogo, trabaja todos los días unas dos horas al dia, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y por pedidos, deja a crédito  y cobra semanalmente, nos cuenta que lo que más vende son los maquillajes y lleva en esta actividad  siete años y que este negocio le ha servido de mucho para sacar a su pequeño hijo adelante.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos, cremas, ropa,  entre otros productos. Sus sueños son tener un carro y un trabajo en su profesión.
texts.en:
The member of the communal bank named "Ecological Park" meet every two weeks in the community of San Eduardo in the city of Portoviejo. This location is known for its beautiful park which attracts tourists and individuals of the region wishing to pass the day surrounded by nature. 

Here we meet Maria. She has been a member of the communal bank for the past two loan cycles.  This is a newly formed communal bank and she feels very comfortable because she has received numerous benefits from Fundacion Espoir (Kiva Field Partner) in support of her business. She is 28 years old, she is divorced, and she has a 3-year old son. She has a degree in nursing. 

She sells Avon brand products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and ladies' accessories).  She also sells clothing through a catalogue, working every day about two hours a day. She makes her sales by traveling from door to door and by taking orders. She completes her sales on credit, collecting weekly payments. She says that her biggest seller is makeup and she has had this business for the past seven years. This business has been a great help in supporting her son. 

This loan will be used to purchase perfumes, jewelry, cosmetics, skin lotions, clothing, and other products. Her dream is to have a car and a job in her profession.

loans.use: To purchase perfumes, jewelry, cosmetics, lotions, clothing, etc.

loans.name: Ramón Daniel

texts.es:
Es Señor Ramón Daniel D. es trabajador de Instituto Nacional Tecnológico, desempeñando el cargo de Mercadólogo desde hace 3 años.
Es casado, con una persona a su cargo en edad escolar.
Este es el tercer crédito que trabaja en CEPRODEL, lo solicita para la compra de materiales de construcción para dos cuartos en su casa, va a comprar arena, Piedrín, cemento, perlínes. Hierro, zinc etc
texts.en: Mr. Ramón Daniel has worked for the National Technological Institute for the past three years teaching marketing. He is married to one of his former students. This is his third loan with CEPRODEL. He is asking for the loan in order to buy materials to be used to build two rooms in his house. He will buy sand, gravel, iron, zinc, etc.

loans.use: He will buy construction materials to build two rooms in his house. There materials will include: zinc,cement, gravel and sand.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
La señora Yolanda P. ha tenido ya dos créditos con Kiva los cuales ha pagado puntual mente.
Esta solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar inmobiliario nuevo para su negocio ya que le esta haciendo falta un equipo nuevo y de mejor calidad, no cuenta con el dinero necesario para realizar la inversión que su negocio necesita. 
Es por eso que solicita su cooperación en este crédito y así poder mejorar su negocio. 
Pagar el préstamo con una parte del las ganancias del negocio ya que es la fuente de ingreso que tiene para ella y sus dos hijo, que actual mente están estudiando.
texts.en:
Yolanda has had two loans with Kiva, both of which were punctually repaid.  She is soliciting another loan to be able to buy new equipment for her business, since she lacks new equipment of better quality. Yolanda doesn't have the money necessary to make the investment that her business needs.

It is for this reason that she is requesting your cooperation on this loan, so that she can improve her business. Yolanda will repay the loan with a part of the business earnings, since this is the source of income for her and her two children who are presently studying.

loans.use: BUYING NEW COOKING EQUIPMENT FOR HER RESTAURANT BUSINESS

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La señora O. F. T. es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora de 42 años quien tiene una pequeña Pulpería la cual inicio el 2001 con la venta de chiverias y gaseosa. En la actualidad ella comercializa desde arroz, frijoles, azúcar, carne, pastas, verduras y frutas etc.

Ella tiene dos hijos uno de 22 años y otro de 9 años por los cuales trabaja arduamente e invertirá el crédito en útiles escolares ya que se aproxima el regreso a clase y tiene muchos encargos.
texts.en:
Sra. O.F.T. is a hardworking, determined, and enterprising woman. She is 42 years old and has a small grocery store that she started in 2001 by selling yogurt and sodas. At the moment she sells rice, beans, sugar, meat, pasta, vegetables, fruit, and other items.

She has two children (ages 22 and 9) for whom she works extremely hard. She will invest in school supplies since classes are restarting and she has many orders.

loans.use: Purchase school supplies to sell

loans.name: Cleofe

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MADRES TRABAJADORAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Cleofe; ella tiene 38 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de transporte, la socia tiene una combi que realiza servicio público donde su esposo es chofer y ella es la que se dedica a cobrar, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere mejorar el servicio público de transporte. La socia solicita el préstamo para el mantenimiento de su combi.                

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sra. Cleofe is a member of the Communal Bank “Madres Trabajadoras” (Working Mothers), which is located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.

She is 38 years old, in a common law marriage, and has three children. Cleofe divides her time between her daily activities and her transportation business. She has a minibus used for providing services to the public. Her husband is the driver while she is in charge of collecting fares. This business provides the means by which her children can get ahead. Cleofe wants to improve her transportation services, so she is requesting a loan to maintain her vehicle.

She is happy with the loan and promises to complete her payments on time.

loans.use: Vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Mariana De Jesus

texts.es:
En la ciudadela San Eduardo, de la ciudad de Portoviejo, se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Parque Ecológico, este lugar es conocido porque aquí hay un hermoso parque el cual es muy visitado por los turistas y personas de la localidad que quieren pasar un dia en contacto con la naturaleza.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Mariana, ella tiene 44 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 13 y 8 años de edad los mismos que estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo es taxista. Hace varios años ella aprendió corte y confección en un taller donde ella laboraba.

Tiene un pequeño taller de costura donde desde hace muchos años se dedica a coser ropa, confecciona todo tipo de ropa, trabaja a base de pedidos de personas particulares y también elabora uniformes para escuelas y colegios de la localidad. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6am hasta las 21h00 y a veces hasta más tarde cuando tiene pedidos que entregar, nos cuenta que son seis años que se dedica a esto desde que se independizó de donde ella trabajaba.

Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar telas y otros materiales para la costura. Es fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta por la forma como se trabaja en el mismo. Sus sueños son tener un taller con operarias y con más maquinarias.
texts.en:
In the San Eduardo neighborhood in the city of Portoviejo, the communal bank Parque Ecológico [Ecological Park] meets bimonthly.  This area is known for its beautiful park which is visited quite frequently by tourists and locals that want to spend the day communing with nature.  

Señora Mariana is 44 years old, married and has two school age children ages 13 and 8.  Her husband works as a taxi driver.  Several years ago she learned the art of dressmaking in the shop where she worked.  She now has her own small shop where for many years she has been making all types of clothing.  She works on an order basis for individuals as well as making uniforms for schools in the area.  She works everyday from 6 am until 9 pm and sometimes until later when she has orders to fill.  She tells us that she has been doing this since she became self-employed six years ago.  

With this loan she is going to purchase fabrics and other materials for her shop.  She is the founder of her communal bank and she is happy with the way it is working.  Her dream is to have a shop with more machines and operators.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics, buttons, fasteners, etc.

loans.name: Asunta

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MADRES TRABAJADORAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Asunta; ella tiene 44 años de edad y es casada y tiene 5 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de picantería (es como un restaurant pero más típico), ella prepara diferentes platos típicos de la ciudad de Cusco y también vende chicha (bebida a base de maíz), ella trabaja desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar la picantería. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar en la picantería.               

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Asunta is a member of the "Madres Trabajadoras" (Working Mothers) community bank which is located in Cusco district, province and department.

Asunta is 44 years old, married, and has 5 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her 'picantería' business (a 'picantería' is like a restaurant only more traditional).  She prepares different traditional Cusco dishes and also 'chicha' (a corn-based drink).  She works from 9.00am to 10.00pm.  Asunta would like to expand and improve her 'picantería'.  She is requesting this loan to buy products to cook in her 'picantería'.

Asunta is pleased to be receiving the loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy products to cook in her 'picantería' (restaurant)

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es:
En la ciudadela San Eduardo, de la ciudad de Portoviejo, se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Parque Ecológico, este lugar es conocido porque aquí hay un hermoso parque el cual es muy visitado por los turistas y personas de la localidad que quieren pasar un dia en contacto con la naturaleza.7

En este lugar conocimos a la señora María Dolores, ella tiene 28 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene  una hija de 6 años la misma que estudia en primer año de escuela. Su esposo es tecnólogo medico. Ella por su parte es Lic. En idiomas y trabaja en la Universidad Técnica De Manabí.

Se dedica a la venta productos por Avon, (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas). Además de ropa por catalogo, trabaja en sociedad con una hermana todos los días unas dos horas al dia, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y por pedidos, deja a crédito  y cobra semanalmente,  ella vende a sus compañeras de trabajo las mismas que son sus clientes hace varios años.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos, cremas, ropa,  entre otros productos. Es fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta por los intereses son más bajos que otras instituciones. Sus sueños son tener un bazar.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the 'Parque Ecológico' community bank meet in San Eduardo neighborhood, in the city of Portoviejo.  This place is well-known for its beautiful park which is very popular with tourists and locals who want to spend a day in touch with nature.

Here we meet María Dolores.  She is 28 years old, married, and has a 6 year-old daughter who is in her first year of elementary school.  María Dolores' husband is a medical technologist.  She has a degree in languages and works at the Universidad Técnica de Manabí (Manabí Technical University).  She also sells Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and ladies' accessories) and sells clothes through a catalog.  In this last business, she works in partnership with one of her sisters.  She works for two hours every day, making her sales door to door.  She takes orders for her products, leaves them on credit and collects payment every week.  She sells to her work colleagues who have been her customers for several years.

María Dolores will use this loan to buy perfume, jewelry, cosmetics, creams, clothes and other products.  She is a founding member of her community bank and she likes the bank because its interest rates are lower than those of other institutions.  Her dream is to own her own store.

loans.use: To buy perfume, jewelry, creams, cosmetics and clothes

loans.name: Los Repollitos Group

texts.es:
El grupo los Repollitos está conformado por tres personas trabajadoras una de ellas Juana Gonzáles de 47 años se dedica a la venta de hot-dog, pasteles, repollitos desde hace 15 años ya que es un producto que se vende a diario. Ella vende de manera ambulante, cuenta con dos vendedores, además entrega estos productos en dos colegios el colegio Bello Horizonte y Colegio Japón, y en el Mercado Oriental. 

G. tiene siete hijos de los cuales tres son menores de edad ellos tienes 15, 12 y 7 años respectivamente. Ella invertirá el crédito en hot-dog, pasteles, repollitos y nacatamales cuales realiza los fines de semana desde diciembre.

Los otros integrantes del grupo son Rober José A. quien vende tajadas con queso desde hace 4 años y Jesenia del Carmen E. se dedica al comercio de queso.
texts.en:
The group, Los Repollitos, is made up of three working members.  One of them is Juana G. of 47 years old.  15 years ago, she began selling on a daily basis hot dogs, pastries, and puffs.  She owns a stall and has two vendors that work for her.  In addition, she sells her products to two schools, Bello Horizonte and Japan School, and also at the Oriental Market.

G. has seven children, three of whom are minors, a 15, 12, and 7 year-old.  She will invest this credit in hot dogs, pastries, puffs, and Nicaraguan-style tamales, which she has been making on the weekends since December.

The other members of the group are Roberto Jose A., who has been selling fried plantain slices with cheese for over four years, and Jesenia del Carmen E., who sells cheese.

loans.use: Make hot dogs, pastries, puffs, and Nicaraguan-style tamales.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es: La señora Teresa J. tiene una tienda de abarrotes y papelería  desde hace 6 años este negocio es su fuente de ingresos para el sostén de la familia. Ella es considerada en esta institución cliente distinguida y esta agradecida por el apoyo brindado ya que ha podido realizar sus proyectos. Teresa desea invertir más en su tienda para así vender más variedad a su clientela y así obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Sra. Teresa J. has managed a grocery store and stationery shop for six years. This business is the source of income to support her family. She is considered to be a distinguished client of Credituyo and is grateful for the support that she has received in order to pursue her projects.

Teresa wants to invest more in her store so that she can sell a greater variety to her customers and earn more income.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Nicasia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MADRES TRABAJADORAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Nicasia; ella tiene 52 años D. edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio D. compra y venta D. golosinas, ella tiene un pequeño puesto en un colegio D. la ciudad D. Cusco, la socia trabaja desD. las 9:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia por medio D. este negocio saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio D. venta D. golosinas. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar golosinas como chupetes, chicles y caramelos al por mayor.   
           
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. su cuota.
texts.en:
This member pertains to the communal bank, “MADRES TRABAJADORAS” (Working Mothers).  This bank is located in the Cusco District, pertaining to the Province of Cusco and the Department of Cusco.  

This is Nicasia of 52 years old.  She is married and has two children.  Her day varies between buying and selling sweets.  She owns a small stall at a school in Cusco and works from 9:00am until 6:00pm.  From this business, she has been able to proviD. her children with a better quality of life.  She would like to broaden her business and is seeking a loan in order to be able to purchase sweets such as suckers, gum, and hard candy in bulk.  She is happy about the loan and promises to fulfill her payments.

loans.use: Purchase sweets in bulk, such as suckers, gum, and hard candy.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase his inventory of merchandise

loans.name: Señor De Wimpillay Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “Señor de Wimpillay” tiene 13 ciclos de funcionamiento (cada ciclo son 4 meses),  el banco comunal está conformado por 11 mujeres y 2 varones. Las reuniones del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la casa de una de las socias. La casa está ubicada en el barrio “Margen Derecha de Winpillay” del distrito de Santiago de la ciudad del Cusco. La mayoría de los socios son vecinos y tienen una buena amistad. 

Los socios son trabajadores y emprendedores que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos.  Las actividades económicas de algunos de los socios a las que se dedican son por ejemplo; venta de crema de leche, venta de frutas, venta de comestibles, venta de muebles, venta de artesanía de tipo trenzado, fabricación y venta de muebles de madera, venta de textiles y venta de comida de forma ambulatoria. Otros socios se dedican a brindar servicios de salón de belleza, empleado de la municipalidad y docencia. 

La socia Isabel, tiene 42 años, vive junto con su pareja y sus hijos en el pueblo joven de manco Ccapac del populoso distrito de San Santiago. Su actividad económica principal de Isabel es la venta de comestibles, ella vende sus productos en la su propia tienda que está ubicada en su domicilio, se la pueden encontrar a la socia en su negocio de lunes a domingo desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien.  Isabel va invertir el préstamo en el capital del negocio y desea comprar más mercadería como por ejemplo arroz, fideos, leche, azúcar y muchas cosas más.
texts.en:
The communal bank, “Señor de Wimpillay”, has gone through 13 loan cycles (each cycle is 4 months).  The communal bank is composed of 11 women and 2 men.  The communal bank's meetings are every thirty days at one of the member's home.  The house is located in the neighborhood, "Margen Derecha de Winpillay" in the Santiago District of the city of Cusco.  The majority of the members are neighbors and are good friends.

The members are workers and entrepreneurs that are always looking for opportunities to move ahead and help give their children a brighter future.  The economic activities of some of these members include, the sale of milk cream, fruit, groceries, furniture, artisan work, the making and selling of wooden furniture, textiles, and food stalls.  Other members offer beauty services, are employed by the municipality, or teach. 

The member, Isabel, is 42 years old and lives with her spouse and their children in a new town, Ccapac, of the populated San Santiago district.  Her main economic activity is the sale of groceries.  She sells her products from her own store that is located in her home.  She works Monday through Sunday from 6am until 9pm.  She has had this business for many years and it is going well.  Isabel plans to invest her loan as work capital for her business and wants to purchase more merchandise such as rice, noodles, milk, sugar, and other things.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise such as rice, noodles, milk, sugar, and other things.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MADRES TRABAJADORAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Olga; ella tiene 35 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de ropa en forma independiente, la socia lleva a diferentes lugares como instituciones y al público en general, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar uso personal para el mantenimiento de su casa.   
           
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “Working Mothers” Community Bank. The bank is located in the district of Cusco, located in the Cusco Province in the department of Cusco. 
This member is Mrs. Olga. She is 35 years old, has a partner and a one-year-old child. This member changes her activities daily. She buys and sells clothes as an independent contractor. She sells her clothes in different places such as institutions and to the general public. She would like to grow her business. She is asking for a loan for personal use for the maintenance of her house.
This member of the cooperative is happy to receive the loan and promises to pay her payments on time.

loans.use: She is asking for this loan for personal uses, for the maintenance of her home.

loans.name: Sonia Esmeralda

texts.es:
Doña Sonia Esmeralda S. G., es trabajadora de la Universidad Nacional Autónoma de Nicaragua (UNAN, dese4mpeñándo el cargo de Aseadora del Departamento de Psicología, desde diciembre del 2001.
Este es el tercer crédito, este es el tercer crédito que trabaja en CEPRODEL, y lo necesita para mejora de vivienda.
Agradece a CEPRODEL por haberle otorgado estos créditos ya que le ayudan a mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en: Doña Sonia works for the National Independent University of Nicaragua (UNAN). She has been working as a housekeeper in the Psychology Department since Dec. 2001. This is her third loan with CEPRODEL. She will use it to improve her house. She is thankful to CEPRODEL, who has allowed her to apply for these loans and has helped her improve her quality of life.

loans.use: To repair her house and other personal expenses.

loans.name: Daysi Monserrate

texts.es:
En la ciudadela San Eduardo, de la ciudad de Portoviejo, se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Parque Ecológico, este lugar es conocido porque aquí hay un hermoso parque el cual es muy visitado por los turistas y personas de la localidad que quieren pasar un dia en contacto con la naturaleza.

La señora Daysi  es socia fundadora del Banco comunal, le gusta por la ayuda y por las facilidades para conseguir los créditos. Tiene 46 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 22 y 18 años de edad, el mayor estudia en Universidad y el menor en colegio que es el que aun viven con ella.

Se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  ventas es puerta a puerta,  vende a través de pedidos que le realizan sus clientes. Trabaja cinco días a la semana, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada fin de semana. Su mercadería la compra en Portoviejo o si no viaja a   Guayaquil cuando puede para traer más variedad de sus  productos, nos cuenta que lo que ella mas vende es ropa de mujer, además que tiene muchos clientes ya que ya lleva con su negocio por más de 15 años en los cuales les ha llevado buenos productos a sus clientes.

Este crédito es para comprar la  ropa más que todo ropa de mujer, pantalones, blusas, y ropa de temporada playera como trajes de baño, entre otras prendas. Sus sueños son seguir adelante.
texts.en:
In the neighborhood of San Eduardo, in the city of Portoviejo, the members of the “Ecological Park” Community Bank meet every fifteen days. This place is known for it’s beautiful park, which is visited by many tourists and local people that want to spend a day in a natural setting. 
Mrs. Daysi is a founding member of the Community Bank. She is liked for her helpfulness and her ability to obtain loans. She is 46 years old, married and from this marriage she has two children, 22 and 18 years old. The oldest studies at the University and the youngest is in high school. The youngest still lives at home. 
Mrs. Daysi sells all types of clothes door to door. She delivers the clothes after customer requests. She gets paid each week. She buys her merchandise in Portoviejo if she doesn’t go to Guayaquil where she can find a greater variety of products. She mostly sells women’s clothes. She has had some customers for over fifteen years as she provides good products for her customers.
This loan will be used to buy more clothes, mostly women’s clothes such as pants, blouses and clothes for the beach season such as bathing suits, among other items. Her dream is to be successful.

loans.use: She will buy women's clothes such as blouses, pants, bathing suits, etc.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “MADRES TRABAJADORAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Luis; el tiene 29 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de transporte, el socio realiza servicio de taxi, el tiene un carro que trabaja en las diferentes calles del cusco desde las 5:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia quiere mejorar el servicio de taxi. El  socio solicita el préstamo para el mantenimiento de su carro.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the "Madres Trabajadoras" [Hard-Working Mothers"] communal bank, which is located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.

This borrower is Mr. Luis.  He is 29 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has two children.  He divides his time between his daily activities and his transportation business.  Luis runs a taxi service.  He has a car and works along the various streets of Cusco from 5:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m.  He would like to improve his taxi service, so he requested this loan for maintenance on his car.

Mr. Luis is happy to receive this loan and promises to comply with the repayment schedule.

loans.use: for car maintenance

loans.name: Karina Luzdelia

texts.es:
En la ciudadela San Eduardo, de la ciudad de Portoviejo, se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Parque Ecológico, este lugar es conocido porque aquí hay un hermoso parque el cual es muy visitado por los turistas y personas de la localidad que quieren pasar un dia en contacto con la naturaleza.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Karina, ella tiene 28 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 5 y 3 años de edad, el mayor está estudiando en jardín de infantes. Su esposo es maestro en un colegio de la ciudad. Ella es Lic. En idiomas y trabaja en la Universidad Técnica De Manabí.

Se dedica a la venta de sabanas, su forma de  ventas es puerta a puerta y también por pedidos. Trabaja dos días en las noches y los fines de semana todo el día, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la compra en una distribuidora en Portoviejo, nos cuenta que ella aprovecha para venderles a sus compañeras de trabajo que la prefieren por el precio y la calidad que ella les ofrece. Lleva en este negocio ya  diez años y nos cuenta que esto le sirvió  mucho para sacar sus estudios adelante.

Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar sabanas y también un poco de ropa de temporada ya que también quiere dedicarse a vender esto. Es fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta porque hay bastantes facilidades de pago. Sus sueños son tener un nombramiento en la Universidad como maestra  en idiomas.
texts.en:
The members of the Parque Ecológico Communal Bank meet every fortnight in the San Eduardo neighbourhood of the city of Portoviejo. This place is known for its beautiful park, visited by many tourists and local people wishing to spend a day closer to nature.

This is where we met Karina, who is 28 years old and married with two children who are 3 and 5 years old. The eldest attends kindergarten. Her husband teaches at a school in the city. She has a degree in languages and works at the Technical University of Manabí. 

She earns a living by selling sheets door-to-door and on order. She works two nights a week and all day at weekends, offering her customers credit and collecting what they owe every fortnight. She buys her stock from a supplier in Portoviejo, and she tells us that she takes the opportunity to sell her goods to her work colleagues, who prefer them due to the price and quality she can offer. She has been in this business for ten years and tells us it has helped her move forward with her studies.

She will use this loan to buy sheets as well as a few seasonal clothes, because she also wants to start selling these. She is a founding member of the communal bank and she likes it because there are enough credit facilities. Her dream is to be employed by the University as a language teacher.

loans.use: To buy sheets and seasonal clothes.

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MADRES TRABAJADORAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Alejandrina; ella tiene 33 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de emolientes y mates, la socia vende en forma ambulatoria tiene una carreta, ella trabaja desde las 5:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta emolientes y mates.La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos para hacer los mates y emolientes.              

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "MADRES TRABAJADORAS" (WORKING MOTHERS) communal bank.  The bank is located in the district of Cusco in Cusco Province in the department of Cusco.

Mrs. Alejandrina is 33 years old, lives in a common-law arrangement and has three children.  She alternates her daily activities with her business of selling emollients and infusions.  She peddles her products from a cart that she uses for her sales, working from 5:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m.  She wishes to expand and improve her current business.  She plans to use the loan to buy more ingredients for her emollients and infusions.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make infusions and emollients

loans.name: Gladys De La Concepción

texts.es:
La señora Gladys B., trabaja en la Universidad Nacional de Ingeniería (UNI), ubicada en la oficina de servicios administrativos, tiene 10 años de laborar como cocinera.
Es madre soltera, su hijo está en edad escolar, ella ya ha pagado 5 créditos en CEPRODEL, los que han pagado puntualmente, los ha utilizado para mejora de su vivienda. Este crédito lo quiere para reparar su vivienda, y para los gastos de la colegiatura de su hijo, ya que en febrero inicia el año escolar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Gladys Bustamente works at the National University of Engineering.  She has worked as a cook fo 10 years in the administrative services building.

She is a single mother and has one school-aged son.  She has taken out 5 loans through CEPRODEL all of which have been paid back on time.  She used the money for home improvement.  She plans to use this loan to make repairs around the house and to pay for school expenses for her son who begins the school year in February.

loans.use: To repair her home and pay for school expenses for her son

loans.name: Belisario

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “MADRES TRABAJADORAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Belisario; el tiene 27 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de anticuchos y también se dedica a ser chofer brindando servicio urbano y su esposa se dedica a la venta de los anticuchos en forma ambulatoria, el socio quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de anticuchos. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos para hacer los anticuchos.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "MADRES TRABAJADORAS" (WORKING MOTHERS) communal bank.  The bank is located in the Cusco District in Cusco Province in the department of Cusco.

Mr. Belisario is 27 years old and lives in a common-law arrangement and has two children.  He alternates his daily activities with his business selling "anticuchos" (skewered meat) and he also works as a driver offering service in the city.  His wife also peddles anticuchos.  

The member wants to expand his anticucho business.  He plans to use the loan to buy ingredients for the anticuchos.

Belisario is very grateful for the loan and is committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make "anticuchos" (skewered grilled meat)

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MADRES TRABAJADORAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Juana; ella tiene 43 años de edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de cosmetóloga y también tiene una tienda de abarrotes, la socia atiende el salón de belleza desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, por medio de estos pequeños negocios la socia saca adelante a su familia, la socia quiere ampliar los negocios. La socia solicita el préstamo para implementar sus negocios.             

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "MADRES TRABAJADORAS" (WORKING MOTHERS) communal bank which is located in the district of Cusco, in Cusco Province in the department of Cusco.

Mrs. Juana is 43 years old and married with two children.  She alternates her daily activities with her cosmetology business.  She also has a grocery store.  And she operates a beauty salon from 8:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m.  Through her different small business activities she is able to provide an income for her family.  Her goal is to expand business and her plans are to use the loan to help her reach that goal.

She is grateful for the loan and is committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To expand her retail business

loans.name: Analffy

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “MADRES TRABAJADORAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Analffy; el tiene 45 años de edad y es casado y tiene 3 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de mecánica de motosierras,el socio atiende desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m y por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el socio quiere construir su casa. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción para su casa.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "MADRES TRABAJADORAS" (WORKING MOTHERS) communal bank which is located in the district of Cusco, in Cusco Province in the department of Cusco.

Mr. Analffy is 45 years old and married with three children.  He alternates his daily activities with his buzzsaw mechanic business that he runs from 9:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m.  This business lets him provide an income for his children but he would like to build his own home.  This member plans to use the loan to buy construction materials for the home.

He is grateful for the loan and is committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy construction materials for his home

loans.name: Alfonso

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Alfonso M. le esta haciendo falta reparación en el exterior y interior de su casa.
Don Alfonso solicita un préstamo para poder comprar el material que necesita para mejorar su vivienda ya que en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario ya que el se encargara de realizar la mejora en horario adicional a su trabajo. 
Planea pagar el crédito con el ingreso que obtiene de su trabajo en una empresa de construcción como albañil. 
Desea que su familia tenga  su casa una casa mucho mejor donde puedan vivir. 
La persona que nos atendió es la señora Cristina Gabriela Vielma  esposa del señor Alfonso M. hay que el se encontraba en su trabajo y portal motivo no nos pudo atender.
texts.en:
Mr. Alfonso M.'s house needs repairs to the interior and exterior parts. 

Alfonso requests a loan to purchase the material he needs to improve their home. He currently doesn’t have the funds that he needs. Improvements to their home need to be done by him after work. 

He plans on repaying the loan with the income he earns from his job at a construction company.  He works as a construction worker. 

He wants his family to have a better home where to live. The person who spoke to us is Cristina Gabriela Vielma, the wife of Alfonso M.. He was at work and could not speak to us in person.

loans.use: To carry out improvements to the exterior and interior of their home.

loans.name: Agustin

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “MADRES TRABAJADORAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Agustin; el tiene 56 años de edad y es casado y tiene 6 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo como constructor, el es maestro de construcción que hace diferentes obras como casas y edificios, el socio por medio de este negocio saca adelante a sus hijos, el socio quiere construir su casa. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción para construir su casa.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Here is a member of the communal bank named "Hardworking Mothers". The communal bank is located in the district of Cusco. It is located in the province and department of Cusco. 

His name is Augustin. He is 56 years old, he is married and he has 6 children. He alternates his daily activities with his work as a construction worker. He is a master construction worker and he takes on various projects, including building houses and buildings. Through his business she is able to provide for his children. He wants to build a house. He requests a loan to purchase construction materials to build a house. 

He is very happy to have a loan and he is committed to making his loan payments.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Personal expenses.

loans.name: María Epifania

texts.es:
La Señora Epifania T., es conserje del Instituto Nacional Tecnológico (inatec), desde hace 11 años.
Ella es soltera tiene 2 personas a su cargo los cuales son mayores de 15 años.
Ya ha pagado 5 créditos en CEPRODEL, siendo una persona responsable con sus pagos, agradece a CDEPRODEL porque estos préstamos le permiten mejorar poco a poco su casa.
texts.en:
Epifania T. has been a janitor at the college named "Instituto Nacional Tecnologico (Inatec)" for the past 11 years.  

She is single and she has 2 individuals in her care, both are over the age of 15. 

She has successfully repaid 5 previous loans with Ceprodel (Kiva Field Partner). She is a very responsible person with her payments. She is grateful to Ceprodel for these loans. They have permitted her to carry out improvements to her home.

loans.use: To build a house.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Auxiliadora Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doña Auxiliadora V. H. es Aseadora del Departamento de servicio al público de la Biblioteca Central en la Universidad Nacional Autónoma de Nicaragua, donde tiene de laborar 24 años.
Es su primer crédito en CEPRODEL, el cual lo utilizara para gastos escolares y mejora de vivienda, compra de 500 bloques, 10 bolsas de cemento, un bidón de pintura y perlìnes
texts.en:
Auxiliadora V. H. is a janitor working for the maintenance department in the central library of the "Nacional Autonoma" university in Nicaragua. She has been working there for 24 years. 

This is her first time loan with Ceprodel (Kiva Field Partner) and it will be used to cover schooling fees and to improve her home. She will purchase 500 construction blocks, 10 bags of cement, and 1 tub of paint, and construction beams.

loans.use: To pay for school fees and to improve their home.

loans.name: Kim

texts.en: Kim S., 42, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia, an area known for being the most populated city in the country. She sells fried noodles, earning an income of USD 17 per day. Her husband always helps her with this business. Each month, the family has to spend USD 130 on food, USD 15 on the children’s education, and USD 55 on other necessary expenses. S. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a new cart to improve her fried noodle-selling business. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy a new cart to improve her fried noodle-selling business.

location.town: Mean Chey District, Phnom Penh City

loans.name: José Clemente

texts.es:
El señor José Clemente G. esta solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar material para su negocio ya que se dedica a la elaboración de protecciones y puertas  metálicas. 
Esta solicitando su cooperación para poder comprar el material y  así poder entregar a tiempo los pedidos de las protecciones y que sus clientes este satisfecho con el trabajo y la puntualidad de la entrega. 
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte de las ganancias del negocio ya que es la fuente de ingresos de su familia y tiene tres hijos que actual mente están estudiando.
texts.en:
Jose Clemente G. requests a loan to purchase materials he needs for his business. He makes security grids and metallic doors. 

He requests your help to purchase the material in order to be able to deliver the products to his clients on time. He wants his clients to be satisfied with the work and with the delivery time. 

He plans on repaying the loan with a portion of his earnings from his business. This business is the only source of income for the family. He has three children who are in school.

loans.use: To purchase working material for his shop.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: Chan M., 44, is married and resides with her husband and five children in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia, an area known for being the most populated city in the country. She sells porridge, earning an income of USD 2 per day. Her husband is employed as a civil servant, earning an income of USD 2 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend USD 105 on food, USD 15 on the children’s education, and USD 5 on other necessary expenses. M. is requesting a loan of USD 600 to purchase more supplies to improve her current business. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy more supplies to improve the current business.

loans.name: Fanny Del Carmen

texts.es:
La Señora Fanny T. G. es trabajadora en la Universidad Nacional Autónoma de Nicaragua (UNAN), desde hace 17 años. 
Esta señora tiene 37 años de edad, es acompañada con dos hijos a cargo en edad escolar.
Es el tercer crédito que trabaja en CEPRODEL, el cual lo utilizara para construcción de vivienda. Agradece a CEPRODEL por brindarle estos créditos ya que le ayudan a mejorar su nivel de vida y la de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Fanny Tellez Gaitan has been an employee of the university "Nacional Autonoma (UNAN)" in Nicaragua for the past 17 years.

She is 37 years old and she has 2 school-aged children in her care. 

This is her third loan through Ceprodel (Kiva Field Partner) and it will be used to build a house. She is grateful to Ceprodel for granting her these loans. They have helped her improve her quality of life, and that of her children.

loans.use: To carry out some home improvements.

loans.name: Ngen

texts.en:
Ngen T., 38, is widowed and resides with her child in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia, the most populated city in the country. She sells vegetables, earning an income of USD 5 per day. Her child is employed at a factory, earning an income of USD 3 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend USD 75 on food and USD 30 on other necessary expenses.

T. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase more vegetables to expand her business. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to expand her business

loans.name: Meng

texts.en: Meng K., 57, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia, an area known for being the most populated city in the country. She sells food, earning an income of 6 USD per day. Her husband is a retired civil servant earning an income of 1 USD per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend 40 USD on food, 8 USD on the children’s education, and 15 USD on other necessary expenses. K. is requesting a loan of 1000 USD to purchase a motorbike for the family to use. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel B. is from the village of Malintubuan, Labason, Zamboanga  Del norte. She is 63 years old. Isabel is a widow and has three adult children. To make a living, Isabel operates a fishing business. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from harvesting and selling farm-raised fish in the local community. Isabel has been engaged in her business for more than 15 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Isabel joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Isabel is requesting a new loan of 60,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fish to raise. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Isabel from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Analisa

texts.en:
Analisa is from the village of Banigan Liloy Zamboanga  Del norte. She is 40 years old. Analisa is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Analisa operates a fishing business. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from harvesting and selling farm-raised fish in the local community. Analisa has been engaged in her business for more than five years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Analisa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Analisa is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fish to raise. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Anailsa from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase fish to raise

Each month the family has to spend $35 US on food, $10 on the children’s education, and $25 US on other expenses. P. is requesting a loan of $1,000 US to purchase a motorbike for the family to use. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair the house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner. P. appears in the photograph with her husband.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for family use

C. is requesting a loan of USD 900 to purchase a trailer to transport her clothes to sell. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. loans.use: Buy a trailer to transport her clothes to sell

loans.name: Van

texts.en: Van N., 35, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorian temples. She sells beef, earning an income of 8 USD per day. Her husband sells cows, earning an income of 6 USD per day to help cover the family's expenses. Each month, the family has to spend 66 USD on food, 15 USD on the children’s education, and 70 USD on other necessary expenses. N. is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD to purchase more cows to improve her husband’s business. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy more cows to improve her husband's business

loans.name: Soem

texts.en: Soem K. is a 47-year-old single woman who currently lives in the province of Kompong Cham. Soem K. has been a farming businesswoman for a long time. Since 1979, Soem K. has owned and operated a farm to cultivate rice, from which she earns a daily income. Soem K. is a widowed mother who has four children, three of whom are single and one married. She has two kids who are sewing workers at the garment factory. Soem K. will be using her loan to add to her personal savings to buy a plot of her neighbor’s farmland, which is a good location for farming. She will use this land to do farming. The loan will provide her with an additional asset.

loans.use: To buy a plot of her neighbor’s farmland for growing rice crop.

loans.name: Neang

texts.en: Neang S., 46, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorian temples. She is a farmer, earning an income of 2.5 USD per day. Her husband produces wooden furniture, earning an income of 4 USD per day to help cover the family's expenses. Each month, the family has to spend 66 USD on food, 7 USD on the children’s education, and 22 USD on other necessary expenses. S. is requesting a loan of 1,200 USD to purchase a motorbike for the family to use. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner. S. appears in the photograph with her husband.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for the family to use

loans.name: Sarina

texts.en:
Everybody values cleanliness. Sarina R., 36, certainly values the same thing, not just in terms of her house and her community, but in her life as well. Sarina reached only high school, but she does not give up opportunities to set her life straight. She is married to Roger, and together they raise their children, who are now in high school. They live together in Bagong Silang, Caloocan City, Philippines.

Sarina co-manages a junk shop with her husband. They work together to help with the cleanliness of the community by recycling junk materials into something reusable. Also, they have a tricycle which they rent out to drivers daily. Their family income ranges around 300 PHP daily out of their business.

To help her with her business, Sarina applied for a loan of 20,000 PHP. She plans to use this money to help her grow her junk shop. She says that she would like to buy additional equipment for recycling. She also needs to buy essential materials for the junk shop, such as metal and galvanized corrugated metal roofing.

Sarina admits that she is frequently tired and appears dirty because of the nature of her work in the junk shop. However, she believes that her business is doing a lot to help her community. It is also in Sarina's heart to help other people in many more ways other than community waste management. But the people who she desires to help the most are her children. 

Sarina wants to be able to send her children to school up until college and give them a good future. She faithfully meets up with other CCT members by attending a fellowship* meeting every week.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To purchase essential materials for the junk shop

loans.name: Soam

texts.en: Soam K., 44, is married and resides with her husband and a child in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorian temples. She is a farmer, earning an income of 2.5 USD per day. Her husband sells cows, earning an income of 4 USD per day to help cover the family's expenses. Each month, the family has to spend 30 USD on food and 46 USD on other necessary expenses. K. is requesting a loan of 600 USD to purchase more cows for her husband to improve his business. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy cows for her husband to improve the business

loans.name: Venus

texts.en: Venus L., one of our CCT* partners, is a doting grandmother with a golden heart. Venus reached third year in college. She is a widow with college children, some of whom are already married. At present, she is working very hard, making sure that her variety store is making profit to meet the daily needs of her family. Together with her children, she lives in Camarin, Caloocan City. Venus runs a sari-sari (variety store) in her community. She has been meeting the daily needs of her community for five years, selling retail items like canned goods, shampoo and detergents. Monthly, she earns an average net income of 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP). To further help her with her business, she is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan. Venus intends to use this money to add to the set of goods she has on display in her store. She believes that having more products for sale will help her business grow. At present, Venus is having problems with the debts of her customers who fail to pay on time. Her young grandchildren also often get food and other items from her store without paying, thinking that Grandma will understand. Nevertheless, Venus plans to resolve this issue and come up with a bigger, better store – not just to serve her community, but to help her family as well. It is still in Venus's golden heart to be able to help her children establish their own families and bless her grandchildren with a good future. * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her variety store

loans.name: Hun

texts.en: Hun N. is married and resides with her husband and six children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean temples. She is a farmer, earning an income of USD 2 per day. Her husband is a teacher, earning an income of USD 2.5 per day to help cover the family's expenses. Each month, the family has to spend USD 30 on food, USD 10 on the children’s education, and USD 45 on other necessary expenses. N. is requesting a loan of USD 400 to purchase a motorbike for the family's use. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner. N. appears in the photograph with her husband.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for the family's use.

loans.name: Deang

texts.en: Deang C. is married and resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean temples. She is a farmer, earning an income of USD 2.5 per day. Her husband is a taxi driver, earning an income of USD 9 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend USD 30 on food, USD 10 on the children’s education, and USD 57 on other necessary expenses. C. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase cows to sell. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy cows to sell.

loans.name: Kouy

texts.en: Kouy K., 59, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean temples. She is a farmer, earning an income of USD 5 per day. Her two children are employed at the factory, earning an income of USD 5 per day to help cover the family's expenses. Each month, the family has to spend USD 42 on food and USD 10 on other necessary expenses. K. is requesting a loan of USD 800 to purchase rice to stock for sale. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy rice to stock for sale.

loans.name: But

texts.en: But S., age 41, makes a living by selling fish. He and his wife sell the fish that they buy from other fisherman in reasonable price and sell it out to again income in the mobile place. He currently earns an average of US$4 a day, and he has been running his business for over ten years. But S. is the father of two children, one is married and earning a profit by selling fish in the busy market. The other one is a student in school. Recently, his family has been facing difficulty in their living conditions due to their house needing repair. To solve the problem, But S. would like a loan to repair a part of his broken house.

loans.use: To repair a part of his broken house.

loans.name: Ros

texts.en: Ros L., age 42, is married to Savouern, age 41. She has three children, two of whom are single and one is married. Ros L. is a local farmer, and she grows rice crops as well as making baskets. Ros L. can earn an income of approximately $2.5 per day in order to help the whole family with daily expenses. Her husband has been earning a living for many years by climbing the palm trees in and around his community, collecting palm juice. This rice harvesting season, Ros L. needs capital to purchase many sacks of rice to store. She will sell them when the rice is commanding the highest price. She will use the remainder fund for assisting her husband to buy containers for collecting palm juice.

loans.use: To stock up rice while prices are low, for future sales.

loans.name: Seng

texts.en:
Seng S., 38, is married and resides with her husband and five children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. She is a housewife, while her husband is a carpenter and a farmer, earning an income of $10 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend $80 on food and $30 on other necessary expenses. 

S. is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase more wood to produce wooden furniture for sale. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: buy more wood to produce wooden furniture for sale

loans.name: Touch

Each month, the family has to spend $55 on food and $10 on other necessary expenses. 

P. is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a truck to transport workers from the factory. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.name: El

El M., 39, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. Each month, the family has to spend $83 on food and $5 on other necessary expenses. 

M. is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase a motorbike to transport clothes to sell. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner. M. appears in the photograph with her daughter.

loans.name: Korng

texts.en:
Korng L., 58, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. She is a housewife while her husband is a traditional doctor, earning an income of approximately $23.80 per day. Each month, the family has to spend $100 on food and $20 on other necessary expenses.

L. is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase a plot of land to resell. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.
