loans.name: Keo

texts.en:
Keo S., 51, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. She sells snacks, earning an income of about $5 per day. Her husband is a carpenter, earning an income of about $3 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend $50 on food and $5 on other necessary expenses. 

S. is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase a motorbike for family use. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: buy a motorbike for the family use

loans.name: Erasmo

texts.es:
Erasmo es un padre de familia de 63 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus dos hijos en el distrito de Nueva Arica, un distrito agrícola de relieve muy accidentado, dada su cercanía a la sierra. Se encuentra ubicado a una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores agrícolas desde hace más de diez años, el cuenta con un terreno agrícola en el cual suele sembrar todo tipo de granos, de sus cosechas y la venta de las mismas depende el sostenimiento económico de su familia por lo que siempre da lo mejor de si para mantener sus cultivos de la mejor manera.

Erasmo desea instalar arroz en su terreno y para ello ha decidido recurrir a Edpyme Alternativa a solicitar un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le permitan realizar la limpieza a su terreno y prepararlo con riegos y abonos.

El ya ha tenido un crédito financiado por el fondo Kiva a través de Edpyme Alternativa. En aquella oportunidad el puedo brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo de maíz y con ello pudo asegurarle el sustento a su familia. El se encuentra contento y bastante agradecido con las personas que le ayudaron en aquella oportunidad.
texts.en:
Erasmo is a family man, he is 63 years old and he lives together with his wife and their two children, in the district of Nueva Arica. It is an agricultural district with moutainous topography, given its proximity to the mountain range. It is located one hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo. 

For the past ten years he has dedicated his time to agriculture. He has land where he sows all types of grains. His family depends on the harvests and the sales of them, which is the reason why he always puts his best effort to keep them in the best way possible. 

Erasmo wishes to sow rice in his land and to this end he has approached Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner).  He requests a loan in the amount of 1000 nuevos soles to clean his land and prepare it with irrigation and fertilizers. 

He has had a previous loan through Kiva, disbursed through Edpyme Alternativa. In that experience, he was able to provide some maintained to his corn harvest and he was able to secure the support of his family. He is very happy and very grateful to the individuals who have helped him.

loans.use: To prepare his land to plant rice.

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
Hong S., 26, is married and resides with her husband and a child in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. She is employed at the factory, earning an income of about $4 per day. Her husband is an electrician, earning an income of about $5 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend $55 on food and $25 on other necessary expenses. 

S. is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for family use. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: buy a motorbike for the family use

loans.name: Thoem

texts.en: Thoem Y. is a married woman living in Kompong Cham province.   She has a knitting business, working from her house to earn income. In addition, she also cultivates a rice crop with her husband. They have five children: four are single and one is married. Two of the children worked as goldsmiths, earning about $100 per month, and contribute some of this income to help the family meet its daily expenses.  Most of their finished products are jewelry made from gold. Unfortunately, their existing equipment to make jewelry are broken in the process of daily use, affecting their business.  To help her chilren, Thoem Y. has requested a loan to buy new equipment to replace the broken one.

loans.use: To buy new jewelry making equipment

loans.name: Navil

texts.es:
Navil es un padre de familia de 30 años de edad, que vive junto a su esposa y sus dos en el distrito de Zaña, una zona agrícola ubicada a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a crianza y venta de ganado vacuno y animales menores. El cría los animales en su casa y los vende a los compradores ocasionales que visitan su zona, también comercializa la leche que producen sus vacas entre sus vecinos. Estos negocios son la única fuente de ingreso familiar por lo que da todo de sí para sacar su negocio adelante.

Actualmente Navil desea invertir en la alimentación de sus animales adquiriendo alimento balanceado de modo que su producción mejore y pueda percibir mejores ingresos, para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Navil ya ha tenido un crédito financiado por Kiva a través de Edpyme Alternativa y de su producto Capital Semilla. En aquella oportunidad pudo adquirir una vaca, con lo cual su negocio pudo crecer y brindarle más ganancias, por ello el se encuentra bastante agradecido con las personas que le apoyaron a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Navil is a family man who is 30 years old and who lives together with his wife and their two children. They live in the district of Zana, an agricultural region located 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. 

He is a farmer who raises and sells cattle and small livestock. He raises his livestock form his home and sells them to the buyers who visit the region. He also produces milk and sells it to the neighbours. These businesses are the only source of income for the family, which is why he gives his all to make them work. 

Navil wishes to invest in the purchase of feed for the animals to secure an improved quality, and to improve his earnings. IN order to meet his objectives he has approached Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) for a loan in the amount of 1000 nuevos soles. 

Navil has had a previous Kiva loan, disbursed through Edpyme Alternativa and its affiliate Capital Semilla. In that experience he was able to purchase a cow. His business increased and his earnings increased. He is very grateful to the individuals who supported him through Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase animal feed.

loans.name: Leilyn

texts.en:
Leilyn, 29 years old, is from the town of Santa Josefa. She is married and has a 3-year-old child. Leilyn is engaged in farming. She plants and harvests rice crops. She currently earns approximately $47 a month from farming. Leilyn also raises hogs for fattening and sale. She works hard to help provide her family's needs.

Leilyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leilyn has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. 

Leilyn is requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP which will be used to buy seeds, fertilizers and pig feeds. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to their house.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and pig feed

loans.name: Han

texts.en:
Han B., 27, is married and resides with his wife in Battambong Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality rice products. He is a construction worker, earning an income of approximately $5 per day. His wife is employed at the factory, earning an income of about $2 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend $50 on food and $10 on other necessary expenses. 

B. is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a new motorbike for family use. In the future, he would like to use any additional income to repair his house. This will be his first loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a new motorbike for family use

loans.name: Abdias

texts.es:
Abdías es un padre de familia de 51 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa y a su hijo en el distrito de Cayaltí, una zona agrícola de regular movimiento comercial que se encuentra ubicada a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

El cuenta con una bodega instalada en su domicilio en donde ofrece a sus clientes diversos productos de primera necesidad, así como abarrotes y artículos diversos. El negocio cuenta con muy buena acogida ya que el siempre trata de brindarle a sus clientes una atención de calidad. Como esta es la fuente más importante de ingresos con la que cuenta, siempre se esfuerza por mantener su negocio del mejor modo posible.

Actualmente Abdías desea ampliar su negocio comprando más productos de modo que pueda satisfacer la demanda con la que actualmente cuenta. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden con el logro de su objetivo.
texts.en:
Abdias is a family man who is 51 years old and who lives together with his wife and their son in the district of Cayatli. It is an agricultural region with regular commercial activities. It is located one hour from the city of Chiclayo. 

He has a grocery store installed in his home and he offers his clients various basic needs products, including groceries, and various merchandise. The business has a steady client base, given that he always works to provide his clients with quality customer service. This is his most important source of income so he always works to maintain his business in the best way possible.  

Abdias wishes to expand his business with the purchase of more products. He wishes to satisfy the client demand. He has approached Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) for a loan in the  amount of 1000 nuevos soles, which will be help him achieve his goal.

loans.use: To purchase inventory for his general store.

loans.name: Lovelyn

texts.en:
Lovelyn L. is from the town of Santa Josefa. She is 34 years old. Lovelyn is married and has two children aged 14 and 11. To make a living, she plants and harvests rice for sale. She also raises pigs that she fattens and sells to the market.

Lovelyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. 

Lovelyn is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Rosa Isabel

texts.es:
Rosa es una madre D. familia D. 37 años D. edad que resiD. junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en una D. los caseríos que conforman el distrito agrícola D. TambogranD., una zona se clima semitropical que se caracteriza principalmente por du producción D. frutas como mango y limón. Pertenece a la región Piura y se encuentra ubicado a más D. cuatro horas D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta D. ganado ovino. Ella cría ovejas en su domicilio, las alimenta en base a granos ay alimento balanceado y cuando estas han alcanzado un buen nivel D. desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donD. resiD.. Esta actividad es su principal fuente D. sustento, por ello siempre trata D. mantenerla del mejor modo posible. 

Actualmente ella desea adquirir más alimento y ovejas para poder ampliar sus ventas y percibir mayores ganancias, para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 800 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Rosa is a mother who is 37 years old and who lives together with her husband and children in one of the communities in the agricultural district of TambogranD.. It is a region of semi-tropical climate known primarily for the production of fruits, such as mangoes and lemons. It belongs to the region of Piura and it is located more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo. 

She raises and sells sheep. She raises sheep from her property, feeding them basic grains and balanced feed. When they have reached a certain level of development she sells them to the merchants who visit the region where she lives. This business is her primary source of income, which is why she tries to maintain them in the best way possible. 

She wishes to acquire more feed and more livestock to improve her sales and her earnings. In order to reach her objective she has approached Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) for a loan of 800 nuevos soles.

loans.use: To purchase feed and livestock.

loans.name: Javier

texts.es:
Javier es un padre de familia de 34 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa y a sus tres hijos en una de los caseríos que conforman el distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona se clima semitropical que se caracteriza principalmente por du producción de frutas como mango y limón. Pertenece a la región Piura y se encuentra ubicado a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado porcino y aves de corral. Ella cría ovejas, pavos y gallinas en algnos corrales situados cerca a su domicilio, las alimenta en base a granos y pastos naturales y cuando han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde reside. Esta actividad es su principal fuente de sustento, por ello siempre trata de mantenerla del mejor modo posible. 

Actualmente Javier desea mejorar la crianza de sus animales adquiriendo alimento balanceado con esta inversión él espera lograr que sus animales se desarrollen de un mejor modo para poder ampliar sus ventas y percibir mayores ganancias, para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Javier is a family man who is 34 years old and who lives together with his wife and their three children in a community in the agricultural district of Tambogrande. It is a region of semi-tropical climate which is primarily known for the production of fruits such as mangoes and lemons. It belongs to the region of Piura which is located more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo. 

He raises and sells pigs and foul. He also raises sheep, turkeys, and chickens in corrals located near his home. He feeds them with grains and natural grasses. When they have reached a certain level in their development he sells them to the merchants who visit the region where he lives. This business is his primary source of income which is why he always tries to maintain it in the best way possible. 

Javier wishes to improve his business with the purchase of balanced feed. With this investment he hopes to have his livestock develop in a better way. He will be able to increase his sales and increase his earnings. In order to meet his objective he has approached Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) for a loan of 800 nuevos soles.

loans.use: To purchase balanced animal feed.

loans.name: Jaime Luis

texts.es:
Jaime tiene 37 años de edad, es soltero y reside junto a sus padres en una de los caseríos que conforman el distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona se clima semitropical que se caracteriza principalmente por du producción de frutas como mango y limón. Pertenece a la región Piura y se encuentra ubicado a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado ovino. El cría ovejas en su domicilio, las alimenta en base a pastos naturales y cuando estas han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde reside. Esta actividad es su principal fuente de sustento, y le permite solventar sus gastos personales, así como ayudar a sus padres. Por ello siempre trata de mantenerla del mejor modo posible. 

Actualmente desea adquirir alimento balanceado para lograr que sus animales se desarrollen de un mejor modo y así poder ampliar sus ventas y percibir mayores ganancias, para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Jaime is 37 years old, he is single and he lives with one of his parents in a community belonging to the agricultural district of Tambogrande. It is a semi-tropical region primarily known for the production of fruits such as mangoes and lemons. It belongs to the Piura region, which is located more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo.

He raises and sells sheep. He raises livestock from his property, feeding them natural grasses. When they have reached a certain level in their development he sells them to the merchants who visit the region where he lives. This business is his primary source of income which is able to provide for his needs, and those of his parents. He always tries to maintain his business in the best way possible. 

He wants to acquire balanced feed to improve the development of his livestock, translating to improved sales and earnings. In order to meet his objective he has approached Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) for a loan in the amount of 1000 nuevos soles.

loans.use: To purchase balanced animal feed.

loans.name: Soem

texts.en:
Soem K. is a 46-year-old married woman who earns an income by cultivating rice crops.  She has been farming since 1979.   Her husband works as a motor taxi driver in and around Kompong Cham province. 

This family normally earns an average of $6 per day to cover their family’s daily living needs. They have six children, all of whom are single. Three of their children are employed in a garment factory in Phnom Penh City. 

In order to earn extra profit, Soem K. is requesting a loan to rent her neighbor’s land in order to plant more rice crop, buy two sacks of fertilizer, and pay plowing cost.

loans.use: To rent land to plant more rice, buy fertilizer, and pay for plowing

loans.name: Heang

texts.en:
Heang T. is a 42-year-old married woman.  She lives in a medium-sized home with family members in Kompong Cham Province. She owns a piece of farmland that she inherited many years ago from her grandparents and uses this land to grow different kinds of crops. She plants rice and vegetable crops every year, and her crops are growing well because she has many years of experience in this sector. 

Presently, Heang T. wants to do dry-season rice farming and to grow vegetable crops on her farmland, but she does not have enough funds. For this reason, she is asking for a loan from Kiva. 

Heang T.'s husband is a construction worker.  She has four children, one of whom is married and three are single.

loans.use: To do dry-season rice farming and grow vegetable crop

loans.name: Than

texts.en:
Than T. is a 41-year-old married man blessed with three children, all of whom are still single.  One of his children is a sewing worker in the garment industry. 

To earn a living, Than T. works as a construction worker in Phnom Penh City. He has a life partner in his wife, who works as a garment worker, earning an income of approximately $3 per day. 

Than T. is building his house, but it is not yet finished because he lacks materials for its construction.  Than T. has  requested a loan to buy extra construction materials to complete his house.

loans.use: To buy construction materials for house

loans.name: Tserendorj

texts.en:
Tserendorj is a 39-year-old man who lives with his wife and three children in the Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. He and his mother live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent and fence. His three children attend a local school, and B. operates a dairy products trading business in his town with the help of his wife. 

They own and raise 200 livestock and prepare a variety of dairy products during the summer months, and sell those products at the local market during the winter months. He began his business in 2003 and has since gained much experience in his business. 

In the future, he plans to continue operating his dairy trading business as a stable operation. B. is a hardworking man and says, "I want to live and work in the countryside as a herder after providing a higher education for my children." 

He is requesting a 600,000 MNT loan in order to purchase a variety of dairy products at wholesale prices as well as to repair his car's engine.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of dairy products to resell

loans.name: Horolsuren

texts.en:
Horolsuren is 54 years old and lives with her husband and 20-year-old son in Bayanhongor province in central Mongolia. She and her daughter live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. Her son currently serves in the Mongolian military while her husband works as a driver and employee for the local civil committee, with a  monthly salary of 200,000 MNT . 

Horolsuren operates a meat trading business in her town. Between 1978 and 1997. She used to work as a foreman in the construction industry. Horolsuren started her own business in 2003 after working as a salesperson at the local grocery shop since 1997. Her business currently has reached to a stable level and she continues to make progress. She hopes to continue growing her business in the future. She is a hardworking and diligent person and is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to purchase more groceries such as meat and dairy products. She sells as a retailer.

loans.use: To purchase more meat and dairy products

loans.name: Munhtuya

texts.en:
Munhtuya is a 40 years old single parent who lives with her three children in the Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. She and her children live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her oldest daughter is a university student while her younger two sons both attend a local high school. After saving money from her previous job as a salesperson at her sibling's grocery store, she purchased a car which enabled her to start her own transportation business in 2005. She has established a stable business in her local community and was able to start operating a second business, which is dairy trading, in 2009, to supplement her earnings. Today, her working capital exceeds 1,000,000 MNT. 

For the future, she hopes to continue to increase both businesses. Munhtuya is a hardworking and diligent person who says, "All I want is to provide a higher education for my three children" She is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan in order to buy more dairy products to sell for the upcoming Tsagaan Sar, Mongolian New Year holiday when demand for such products rise.

loans.use: To buy more dairy products

loans.name: Yin

texts.en:
Yin Y. is a mother caring for four children, all are attending the local school and are dependent on her income. She is married to Roeurn, who earns his daily income by climbing the palm trees behind his house (to collect sap).  He has been in this business since 2000.  Palm-tree-climbing as an occupation is very common in the countryside for poor men.  

Because the equipment Yin Y.'s husband uses for climbing palm trees is getting old – some are broken down, it is hard for him to operate his business. Yin Y. wants to help her husband's business, so she decided to request a loan for him to buy ladders to climb the palm trees. Yin Y. and her husband are both in the picture.

loans.use: To buy ladders to climb palm trees

loans.name: Bayarmaa

texts.en:
Bayarmaa is 48 years old and lives with her husband and two sons in the Tuv province of central Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent and fence. Her oldest son operates a cellphone repairing business and her youngest son attends university in Ulaanbaatar, a capital city of Mongolia. Her husband is currently unemployed and works for the construction companies during the summer months. 

Bayarmaa operates clothes trading business out of a stall in a local trade center. She began her household goods trading business in 2005, after 2 years she started to sell clothing and has has since gained significant experience and skills in her business. Her business has stabilized over the past year and she was able to buy her own stall where she sells her products. She imports her products from China twice a month.

 For the future, she plans to expand her business and enlarge her house. Bayarmaa is a modest and hardworking person and is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT in order to import a large amount of goods from China to increase her sales.

loans.use: To import large amount of goods

loans.name: Nargis' Group

texts.en:
Nargis lives in Kamoki, which is a small city of Punjab Pakistan and famous for its agriculture industry.  She lives there with her family in the area named Khan piyara, in a 2 room brick house. She moved there after her marriage. She is married to B. M. who has a construction supply business at the market. He offers his services to different construction companies and to regular customers and earns a good income by completing their orders on time. 

Nargis has given birth to 2 sons and a daughter. Her elder son has a sanitary supply business, while her younger one works in a factory.  
Nargis herself is a talented lady who owns & operates an embroider business at her home. She does this work to share the financial burden of her husband. She receives orders from the neighboring customers and earns a good income by completing them on time. Her daughter also helps her in her embroider business. 

Nargis has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the expansion of her embroidery business. She will utilize the loan money in buying embroidery material such as beads, colored thread and material in bulk which will help her offer more variety to her clients and in increasing her income as well.  

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In previous loan years, she has established a good credit behavior and never missed a loan group meeting. 

Note: "In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Nargis".

loans.use: To buy embroidery material for her  business

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda S. is from the village of Eastern Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 48 years old. Rosalinda is separated from her spouse and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Rosalinda owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, snack foods, canned goods, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Rosalinda has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 6500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rosalinda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosalinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Rosalinda is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell, like detergent & canned goods. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Rosalinda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell, like detergent & canned goods

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites P. is from the village of Eastern Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 41 years old. Marites is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, she owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling vegetables and spices like garlic, onions and black pepper in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $250 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Marites joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. 

Marites is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like spices and food seasonings. This will be her 3rd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like spices and food seasonings

loans.name: Saima's Group

texts.en:
Saima lives in a small housing colony in the city of Kamoki which is located in Punjab, Pakistan, which is known for its agriculture industry. She has been living there for over ten years. She is a housewife and she prefers to stay at home and take care of her household responsibilities. She has given birth to a daughter who is two years old. 

Her husband’s name is A. M. and he operates two businesses. He runs a grocery store in the market through which he offers daily use items to his clients, which include cooking oil, rice, sugar and spices, etc., and he has also put seasonal vegetables outside of his shop to sell to his clients.
 
Saima has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband’s businesses. With the loan, he will buy groceries and some seasonal vegetables which will help him in increasing his sales and in earning a good income as well. He has been in this business for over ten years, and Saima is hopeful that this investment will be a profitable one for him. 

She is a new loan user of Asasah. She is confident that the loan investment will help her husband in improving his business conditions which will help her family to live a better life. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Saima.

loans.use: To buy groceries and vegetables to resell

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl M. is from the village of Eastern Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 21 years old. Cheryl is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, she is a dealer, selling cosmetics and beauty products from AVON and NATASHA in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately $175 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Cheryl joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. 

Cheryl is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell, like lotions and cosmetics. This will be her 3rd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like lotions and cosmetics

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie D. D. is from the village of Eastern Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 40 years old. Melanie is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods and toothpaste in the local community. Melanie has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $125 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Melanie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital.

loans.name: Noreen's Group

texts.en:
Noreen lives in a small housing colony in the city Kamoki which is located in Punjab, Pakistan, and known for its agriculture industry. She has been living here for over ten years in a two-room brick house. 

Her husband is a welder by profession and is the only earning person in the family. He started this business five years ago and it is working well for him currently. Through his business he offers iron and spare parts repairing services to his customers. 

Noreen herself is a housewife and prefers to stay at home taking care of her household responsibilities. She has given birth to a son and a daughter. Both are less than four years old and have not started attending school yet. 

Noreen has applied for a loan from the Kiva partner, Asasah, to financially assist her husband. He will utilize the loan money in purchasing another welding machine, and he will also hire an assistant. This will help him in completing his work in less time and provide better quality services to his customers. 

Noreen is hopeful that this investment will make a positive impact on her husband’s business and that she will be able to save enough money from his profits to pay for the admission of her children to school next year. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In the previous loan year, she established good credit behavior and never missed a meeting. Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Noreen.

loans.use: To buy another welding machine for the business

Lesya and her husband, Taras, have been remodeling one room in their apartment. They used a previous loan to fix the walls and the floor. Now, Lesya is asking for a loan of 7,500 Grivnas to purchase new furniture for their room.

loans.name: Lhagvasuren

texts.en:
Lhagvasuren is 51 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Bayanhongor Province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a 'ger', a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent and fence. His oldest daughter works for the local vocational training center as an English teacher and earns a monthly salary of 150,000 MNT, while his younger two children both attend a local secondary school. 

Lhagvasuren works for the steam heating factory as a machinist with a monthly salary of 120,000 MNT, and he and his wife also operate a dairy retail business together. He and his wife started their business in 1998, selling only beverages outside the market. He quickly found success with his new business and managed to expand his business by selling a variety of dairy products and meats. He hopes to continue to grow his business so that he can have his own grocery shop. He is requesting a 650,000-MNT loan to purchase more dairy products and meats at wholesale prices.

loans.use: To purchase more dairy products and meats

loans.name: Shameem's Group

texts.en:
Shameem comes from Okara which is a small city in Pakistan, known for its agriculture industry. She lives there in the area named Kot Nihal Singh with her family in a 2-room brick house. She moved here 9 years ago. She is 35 years old and married to H. M. who works in a government organization for a low income. 

Shameem supports her family by doing sewing work. She does the work according to orders which she receives from neighborhood clients. She has a good number of clients due to her quality of work. She uses the income in paying their utility bills and the school fees for her children. 

Shameem is the mother of five sons. Three of them are enrolled in a local school and getting their education. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to further improve her business of sewing. She will use the loan money in buying a new sewing machine because her previous machine has become old and is not producing a quality work. The new machine will help her finish orders on time so she receives more orders every month. She has been operating this business for over 8 years and is very hopeful that it will expand further after the loan investment. 
   
She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine for sewing business

loans.name: Aynudin

texts.ru: Курбонов Айнудин житель района Восе. Возраст, 41 год. Женат. Имеет двоих детей. Образование средне - специальное, товаровед. По специальности не работает. Он занимается растениеводством. При доме имеет земельный участок, где сеет пшеницу и выращивает овощи. Уже три года он занимается этим видом деятельности. Кредит берет для посева пшеницы и овощей. То есть на полученный кредит он намерен закупить семена.
texts.en: Aynudin K., 41, lives in Vose with his wife and two children. Although Aynudin received training as a commodities expert, he works in crop production. He owns a plot of land where he grows wheat and vegetables. Having been in this business for three years, he is applying for a loan that he would use for for buying seeds for planting vegetables and wheat.

loans.use: to buy seeds

loans.name: Odonchimeg

texts.en:
Odonchimeg C. is 35 years old and lives with her daughter in the Tuv province of central Mongolia. They live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian tent home. Her daughter attends a local school and Odonchimeg operates a meat trading business, which she started in 2006. 

She has gained much selling experience over the years and has built a a very positive reputation among her many customers. 

Her parents are herders in countryside and she gives her purchased livestock to her parents so that she can sell when prices of livestock rise. 

After years of operation, she has establish a stable business and her earnings have enabled her to decorate her entire home. For the future, she hopes to continue to grow her business and start saving for her daughter's future tuition fees. 

Odonchimeg is a clever and hardworking person. She is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more meat to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more meat

loans.name: Janankan's Group

texts.en:
Janankan J. is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Nookat, a small village near Osh. She is 45 and married to a builder. She has two sons and two daughters. The older son and the older daughter are working in Russia and the other children study at school. 

In order to earn additional money to cover family expenses Janankan breeds cattle. With money received from the loan she wants to purchase a cow for breeding. In the future, Janankan wants to save money to build a house for her son.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line: people (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase a cow

Hajii has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities. 

Hajii  decided to pursue the beauty parlor business because he finds it more profitable and it needs less maintenance than a retailing business.

In 2010, Hajii joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. Hajii has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand his business.

loans.name: Nhem

texts.en:
Nhem N., 35, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. 

She weaves Cambodian silk, earning an income of US $2 per day. Her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of US $2 per day to help cover the family expenses. 

Each month, the family has to spend US $35 on food, $5 on the children’s education, and  $40 on other necessary expenses. N. is requesting a loan of US $400 to purchase more raw silk to produce silk products. 

In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

For the future, she plans to continue to grow her business so that she can open her own hair salon. 

Sarangerel is an honest and modest person and is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan in order to replace her old equipment and tools for her hair salon.

loans.name: Suhbaatar

texts.en:
Suhbaatar is 31 years old and lives with his wife and four children in the Bayan-Ulgii province of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent and his four children all attend a local school. Suhbaatar operates a motorcycle repair service in his town. He started this business based on his previous experience of operating a taxi service using his own motorcycle. After years of operation, Suhbaatar has built a stable operation with many permanent customers. In addition, he drives a taxi to supplement his earnings. Suhbaatar’s average monthly income is 200,000 MNT and his monthly net profit exceeds 150,000 MNT. 

Suhbaatar is requesting a 400,000 MNT loan to purchase necessary tools, supplies, and repair materials for his shop. In the future, he hopes to expand his business and adds “all I want is to provide higher education for all my four children.”

texts.en: Tuya is 43 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in the Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent and fenced-in-area. Her husband works as a fireman for the local hospital with monthly salary of 120,000 MNT, and her child attends a local vocational training school, majoring in construction, with a monthly scholarship of 45,000 MNT. Tuya operates a meat and dairy retail business in her town. She started her business in 1995 after operating a cigarettes-trading business from 1991. With her earnings, she managed to expand her business.  Her earnings have also enabled her to decorate her entire home. She hopes to continue to grow her business so that she can build her own grocery shop within her fenced-in-property. She is a hardworking and diligent person. She is requesting a 700,000 MNT to purchase more dairy products and meats at wholesale prices.

loans.use: To purchase more dairy products and meats at wholesale

loans.name: Jovey

texts.en:
Jovey S. is from the village of Kabatangan, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 38 years old. Jovey is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Jovey owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, canned goods, snack foods, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Jovey has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Jovey joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jovey has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Jovey is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell, like detergents & instant noodles. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Jovey from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell, like detergents & instant noodles

loans.name: Hem

texts.en:
Hem N. is 33 and married with two children. She lives with her family in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. Hem weaves Cambodian traditional silk and earns a daily income of 3 USD. Her husband is a construction worker and earns 2 USD a day to help cover the family’s expenses. Each month, the family has to spend 50 USD on food and 53 USD on other necessary expenses. 

Hem is requesting a loan of 900 USD to purchase raw silk to produce woven silk products. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner. In the future, Hem would like to use aN. additional income to repair her house.

loans.use: to buy raw silk

loans.name: The Amna Muhammad Altaf Group

texts.en:
Amna is married and the mother of three sons and two daughters. She lives in a two-room brick house with her family in an area named Kot nihal singh in Okara, a small city in Pakistan that is known for its agriculture industry. Amna sews clothes for her neighbors and works as a housewife to provide for her family and share the family’s financial burden with her husband. All of her children are attending school, except for the youngest who is still too young. Amna is literate and she teaches students in her home to earn extra income.

Amna’s husband is M. A.. He is involved in a dairy business and has a buffalo at home that provides milk to sell. He has a number of customers in the neighborhood and earns a good monthly income. Amna is applying for a loan from the Kiva partner Asasah to purchase another buffalo to increase the family’s ability to sell milk and serve more clients. Amna is hopeful that, with this loan investment, her husband will be able to increase his business profit.

Amna is a regular Asasah loan recipient and this will be her third loan. She has a good repayment record and has never missed a loan group meeting.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo

loans.name: Miriam Wanjiru

texts.en:
Miriam has been practicing farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 30 years.  She is 56 years old, married to Isaac M., and they have three children.

She was introduced to KADET by her friend.  This will be her first loan.  She is planning to use the loan amount to buy potato seedlings and fertilizer.

In the future, Miriam hopes to practice large scale farming.

loans.use: To buy potato seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Khayruddin

texts.ru: Курбонов Хайруддин проживает в районе Восе. Ему 42 года. Женат. Имеет 5 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Хайруддин имеет высшее образование, инженер. По профессии не работает. Более 5 лет занимается растениеводством. Он в основном выращивает овощи для продажи. Целью кредита является закуп семян и минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Khayruddin K., 42, lives in Voce with his five children and his wife who is a homemaker. Khayruddin has a university degree in engineering but he has spent the past five years working in crop production. He grows vegetables for sale and is now applying for a loan to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza V. is from the village of Malinao, Kalilangan, Bukidnon. She is 25 years old and has two school-aged children. Analiza is separated from her spouse. To make a living, Analiza owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. Her main source of income comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, canned goods, junk foods, soap, and toothpaste in the local community. Analiza has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

Analiza joined HSPFI in 2010 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She  has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to purchase additional inventory and use as working capital. Analiza is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods and beverages. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Analiza from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated with her loan to improve and expand her business. 


About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Meng

texts.en:
Meng P. is 32 and married with a child. She lives with her family in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. Meng is employed at the local factory and earns a daily income of 2 USD. Her husband produces traditional cakes and earns a daily income of 3 USD to help cover the family’s expenses. Each month, the family has to spend 40 USD on food and 60 USD on other necessary expenses. 

Meng is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD to purchase supplies to improve her husband’s cake production business. This will be her third loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner. In the future, Meng would like to use any additional income to repair her house.

loans.use: to buy cake production supplies

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios S. is from the village of Kabatangan, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 52 years old and married with three adult children. To make a living, Remedios owns and operates a habal-habal (multiple-person motorcycle taxi service) business. Her main source of income comes from providing this service, with her husband as the driver, to local community members. Remedios has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. 

Remedios joined HSPFI in 2010 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Remedios has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to purchase materials and expand her business. She is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP to purchase motorcycle maintenance tools. This will be the third loan taken out by Remedios from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated with the loan to improve and expand her business. 


About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tools

loans.name: Michael Chepkwony

texts.en:
Michael Chepkwony M. is a married man of sixty-one years.  He sells fruits in Cheplaskei in Eldoret town.  He has four children. Michael has been in this business for seven years now and earns a monthly income of eight thousand shillings.

This will be Michael's first loan from KADET LTD.  He plans to use the loan to buy  different types of fruits for resale in his business. 

In the future, he wants to complete building his family house (which is half-way built), and to have a wholesale shop for cereals.

loans.use: To buy assorted fruits for resale

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena J. is from the village of Tumbao, Banisilan, South Cotabato. She is 57 years old and married with two school-aged children. To make a living, Lorena owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. Her main source of income comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, junk foods and toothpaste in the local community. Lorena has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. 

Lorena joined HSPFI in 2009 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lorena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Lorena is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods and junk foods. This will be the third loan taken out by Lorena from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated with her loan to improve and expand her business. 


About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase products to sell

loans.name: Floro

texts.en:
Floro C. is from the town of Trinidad. He is 43 years old. Floro is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Floro owns & operates a business venture in the services sector providing waste management services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating "habal-habal" (motorcycle) transport service. Floro has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

Floro joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Floro has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Floro is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Floro from CEVI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: To purchase tires and other accessories

loans.name: Loice Khayanje

texts.en:
Loice Khanyanje M. is a single woman of forty years.  She has two children who are still in school.  She runs a salon in Iten town, on the outskirts of Eldoret. Loice has been in this business for 12 years and earns a monthly income of thirty thousand shillings.

This will be Loice's fourth loan from KADET LTD.  She has a  good history with KADET, and had successfully repaid all her previous loans.  With this new loan, she plans to buy a new salon dryer and more salon equipment.  She plans to use the income she earns to reinvest into the business. 

In the future, she wants to buy a plot of land and build rental houses to get additional income, and to educate her children to the highest level of education.

loans.use: To buy equipment for beauty salon

loans.name: Sarantuya

texts.en: Sarantuya is a 49 year-old widow and lives with her son in Bayanhongor province in central Mongolia. She and her son live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent in her sibling's fence. Her son, age 26, works for the local gold mine, with a monthly salary of 400,000 MNT. Sarantuya currently operates a grocery trading business in her town. She started her business in 2000 after working for the trade company between 1985 and 1993.  In the future, she plans to expand her business by increasing her product line. Sarantuya says, "My dream is to open my own grocery shop." She is requesting a 300,000 MNT loan to purchase more grocery products to increase her working capital for her grocery trading business.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery products

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
Mary Joy A. is from the town of Trinidad. She is 20 years old. Mary Joy is married and has 2 infant children. To make a living, Mary Joy owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Mary Joy has been engaged in her business for over 2 years.

Mary Joy joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Joy is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase seeds and fertilizers. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Mary Joy from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Jiji

texts.en:
Jiji Q. is from the village of Kabatangan, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 29 years old. Jiji is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Jiji owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling daily use products such as shampoo, canned goods, snack foods, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Jiji has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Jiji joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Jiji has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. 

Jiji is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods and snack  foods. This will be the third loan taken out by Jiji from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Escona

texts.en:
Escona T. is currently in a business of selling fish. She is 23 years old and married to a GoSS (Government of Southern Sudan) worker. She has two children who do not go to school.

She requested a loan to stock more fish to sell. She hopes to expand her business with extra profits in the future.

loans.use: To stock more fish to sell

loans.name: Shahida's Group

texts.en:
Shahida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her business of selling paper envelops. She receives orders from different stationary shops in the market and fulfills them in a timely way to earn an income for her family. With the loan she will buy paper envelops in bulk and increase her sales.
 
She started this business after the death of her husband. It was a time of great difficulty for her, but she faced it bravely.
  
Shahida couldn’t provide education facilities to her children due to financial constraints. Now both of her sons also work to contribute to the family financially. Her elder son works in the motor workshop while the younger one is an employee in a general store.
 
She lives with her family in Okara, which is a small city in Punjab, Pakistan, known for its agriculture industry. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her fifth loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.

loans.use: To buy paper envelops for selling

loans.name: Tsend-Ochir

texts.en:
Tsend-Ochir E. is 52 years old and lives with his wife and three children in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent, in the Uvs province of Mongolia. 

His oldest daughter is a university student while his younger two daughters both attend a local high school. 

Tsend-Ochir works as a carpenter to support his family. He has owned his carpentry business for almost 15 years and over this long time he has earned the loyalty of his customers because of the quality of his work and service. 

After Tsend-Ochir produces a variety of wooden items, his wife sells those products out of a shipping container that they own at the local market. 

After many years of running this business, he was able to start building his own work place which is under construction now. Tsend-Ochir plans to expand his business by hiring one more assistant carpenter in order to expand his production in the future. His earnings have enabled him to pay his oldest daughter's tuition fees and provide for his entire family. 

Tsend-Ochir is a hardworking man and is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan in order to purchase more timber for his growing carpentry business.

loans.use: To purchase more timber

loans.name: Virgie

texts.en:
Virgie D. C. is from the village of Eastern Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 37 years old. Virgie is married and has three school-aged children. 

To make a living, Virgie runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling eggs, bananas and vegetables like squash in the local community. Virgie has been engaged in her business for more than three years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

Virgie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Virgie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. 

Virgie is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products, like bananas, to sell. This will be the third loan taken out by Virgie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Benhur

texts.en:
Benhur E. lives in the town of Trinidad. He is 26 years old, married and has two children who are ages eight and two. He earns a living by providing "habal-habal" (or motorcycle) transport services. He also started and runs a small repair and vulcanizing shop, and hopes to acquire more of the materials he needs to run this shop.

Benhur joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his life and ability to engage in business. He has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI and is applying for a new one, for 8,000 PHP, to buy tires and other items for his shop. He plans to use the additional revenue generated by his business to establish a fund he can use in emergencies.

loans.use: to buy tires and other items for a repair shop

loans.name: Chawki

texts.ar:
شوقي في عمر 30 سنة يعمل في بيع الهواتف له في عمله 10 سنوات متزوج وله ولدان يحب مصلحته يحلم دائما بالاستقلالية في العمل
له زبائن من محيطه وجيرانه يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء بضائع جديدة للمحل ويحلم دائما في بناء مؤسسة تجارية
كبيرة لبيع الاجهزة الخليوية طموح ويسعى جاهدا الى تطوير مستقبله ومستقبل اولاده
texts.en: Chawki is a 30-year-old husband and father of two who is very driven to secure his family’s future. For the past decade, he has been selling telephones to members of his community. He loves his business very much and constantly dreams of starting his own large company to sell cellular phones. For the moment, however, Chawki just wanted to ask for a loan from Al Majmoua to purchase more items for his shop.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for cell phone shop

loans.name: Lalyn

texts.en:
Lalyn A. lives in the village of Eastern Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 21 years old, single and makes a living by running a shop that sells ready-to-wear and ukay-ukay (or used) clothing. She has been in this business for more than three years and earns about 10,000 PHP a month from her work.

Last year, Lalyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI and is applying for a new one, for 8,000 PHP, to buy more used clothing to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by her business to continue expanding it. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy additional used (ukay-ukay) clothing to sell to her customers

loans.name: Abed Al-Karim

texts.ar:
عبد الكريم في عمر 40 سنة متزوج وله 3 اولاد يعمل في بيع الساعات والفوبيجو له في عمله 20 سنة سحي مصلحته يسعى الى
تطوير نفسه وعمله يريد تعليم اولاده ويحلم بان يصبح صاحب مؤسسة مستقلة له لبيع الاجهزة الكهربائية له تاريخ جيد
مع المجموعة يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى دفع الاقساط الجامعية والمدرسية للأولد خاصة ان حلمه هو تعليمهم وتوصيلهم
الى اعلى المراكز الاجتماعية يتميز عمله بالقدة وقلة المنافسة في محيطه خاصة انه استطاع ان يوسع عمله الى البيع بالجملة
ايضا
texts.en: Abed al-Karim is a 40-year-old husband and father of three who has been selling watches and imitation jewelry for the past twenty years. He is determined to develop himself and his business and dreams of one day owning his own electronics store. By converting to a wholesale format, Abed al-Karim’s business has been able to keep ahead of the competition. Going beyond work, Abed al-Karim wanted to ask for a loan from Al Majmoua to pay his children’s tuition, since he is hoping that they will be able to use their education to move up the social ladder.

loans.use: To pay children's tuition

loans.name: Ma. Teresa

texts.en:
Ma. Teresa D. C. lives in the village of Poblacion, Kalilangan, Bukidnon. She is 38 years old, married, has three school-aged children and makes a living by running a sari-sari (or variety) store where she sells items people need daily such as shampoo, canned goods, snacks, soap and toothpaste. She has been in this business for more than five years and earns about 5,000 PHP a month from her work.

In 2009, Ma. Teresa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid three previous loans from HSPFI and is applying for a new one for 5,000 PHP to buy more items to sell to her customers. She plans to use the additional revenue made possible by this loan to continue expanding her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy additional food items to sell to her customers

loans.name: Columba

texts.en:
Columba S. lives in the town of Trinidad. She is 61 years old, married and makes a living by selling fish and other kinds of food, including rice and various local delicacies. The fish she sells is caught locally, and she works very hard to have a stable business and income. 

Columba joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI and is applying for a new one, for 8,000 PHP, to buy additional items to sell to her customers. She plans to use the additional revenues made possible by this loan to continue expanding and improving her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell to her customers

loans.name: Chham

texts.en: Chham T., 39, is married and lives with his wife and four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for ancient temples. He works at a private company, where he makes about $6 a day. His wife is a farmer, and earns about $1 a day. Each month, the family spends about $50 on food and $85 on other necessities. He is applying for a loan for $1,200 to buy a new motorbike for his family to use. In the future, he would like to earn enough money to improve and repair his family's home. This is his second loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: buy a new motorbike for his family to use

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline I. is from the town of Trinidad. She is 45 years old. Evangeline is married and has 3 children aged 22, 19 and 12. To make a living, Evangeline owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Evangeline has been running her store for 7 years now.

Evangeline joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evangeline has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Evangeline is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell, like soft drinks and canned goods. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Stock more goods to sell

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly L. is from the village of Macaopao, Kalilangan, Bukidnon. She is 52 years old. Nelly is married and has 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Nelly owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods,snack foods & toothpaste in the local community. Nelly has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Nelly joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nelly has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Nelly is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell, like canned goods & snack foods. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Nelly from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica L. is from the village of Macaopao, Kalilangan, Bukidnon. She is 39 years old. Jessica is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Jessica owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods & toothpaste in the local community. Jessica has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jessica joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jessica has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Jessica is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell, like snack foods & canned goods. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Jessica from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

loans.name: Asia's Group

texts.en:
Asia lives in Okara, which is a small city in Pakistan and known for its agriculture industry. She lives there in the area called Kot Nihal Singh, with her family in a 2 room brick house.  She is 20 years old, married recently to M. R., and has a one month-old baby girl. 
Her husband is a loader by profession and operates a donkey cart, while she supports her husband financially by doing embroidery at her home. Most of her clients are within her community and give her orders regularly, which she completes to earn an income. 
She is a very good administrator and manages her business, as well as her household, very well. 
Asia has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, to financially support her husband. With the loan he will buy a new donkey cart, because his current cart has grown rough and needs a replacement. A new cart will enable him to put more loads on it and provide better quality services to his clients. 
He has been doing this work for the past 9 years, and Asia is hopeful that through this loan investment her husband will be able to get good outcomes from his business. 
She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In the previous loan year, she has established a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.

Note: "In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Asia".

loans.use: To buy a new donkey cart for loading business

loans.name: Gerelina

texts.en:
Gerelina L. is from the town of Trinidad. She is 43 years old. Gerelina is married and has 3 children aged 16, 14, and 12. To make a living, Gerelina owns & operates a business venture in the food sector, making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from making "puto" (rice cakes) and other delicacies for sale. Gerelina also helps her husband plant and harvest rice crops on their farm.

Gerelina joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gerelina is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the first loan taken out by Gerelina from CEVI.

loans.use: to invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
