loans.name: Tabitha Wamaitha

texts.en:
Tabitha Wamaitha N. is a woman of twenty seven years.  She is married to Charles Njuguna, who runs taxi business in Lodwar Town.  They are blessed with two beautiful children.  They currently reside in Lodwar. 

Tabitha has a mali kwa mali (exchange of goods for goods) retail business.  She has been in this business for four years now.

This will be Tabitha's first loan from  KADET LTD.   She plans to use the loan to buy more stock for her business.  With the income generated, she wants to support her husband in buying another car for his taxi business.  

In the future, she wants to be financially stable and be able to provide for every basic need for her family.

loans.use: To buy more stock for trading business (e.g basins, plastic buckets, jugs, etc.)

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is currently in the business of selling beans, cooking oil, onions and "kimbo". She is 42 years old, a widow with one child who goes to school. She took out a loan to stock  more bags of beans, more litres of cooking oil, more sacks of onions, and more kimbo to sell. Rose hopes to expand her business with extra profits in the future.

loans.use: Stock more bags of beans, litres of cooking oil,  sacks of onions, etc.

loans.name: Mbithi

texts.en: Mbithi is 40 years old, married and a member of Faulu Kenya under the Bombolulu group.  He runs a "matatu" (van) transport business in the Kibera slums.  He has been engaged in this business for five years.  Currently, he has employed two people.  He hopes that someday he will open his own transport company.  He sees himself being a successful businessman in the next five years.  He has requested a loan of 80,000 Kenya shillings to buy paint and repair his van.

loans.use: To buy paint and repair his van

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie B. is from the village of Poblcaion 2, Banisilan, South Cotabato. She is 58 years old. Rosie is married and has 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Rosie owns & operates a business venture making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from making and selling specialty food like "arrozcaldo" or chicken porridge in the local community. Rosie has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Rosie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosie is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make specialty foods like "arrozcaldo". This will be the 1st loan taken out by Rosie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.name: Laura

texts.en: Laura is a thirty-eight-year-old married woman with two children living in her own house in Fort Portal, Uganda, longing to educate her children up to university level. She sells clothes and has been in business for ten years. It is at its boom stage. She still has a challenge of limited finances to meet customer demands. Her desire is to own a boutique. Laura needs the loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: Buying clothes for sale

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther E. is a thirty-eight-year-old woman.  She is married to Nasak, who is a businessman in Lodwar town.  Together they have two children.  They currently reside in Soweto in Lodwar town.

Esther runs a pharmacy in the same area.  She has been in this business for nine years and earns a monthly income of thirty thousand shillings.

This will be Esther's first loan from KADET LTD.  She plans to use it to buy different types of chemist drugs for her store.  With the income generated, she wants to reinvest back into her business by buying more stock. 

In the future, she wants to be financially stable, to sustain herself financially.

loans.use: To buy more drugs for pharmacy business

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet is a thirty-seven-year-old married woman with four children living in her own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. She is charged with the responsibility of looking after her family with the help of her husband and her dream is to educate her children. She has been a hairdresser for two years and the business is still growing amidst challenges of lack of enough skilled labor and limited finances. Juliet needs the loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: Paying school fees

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria A. is from the town of Trinidad. She is 56 years old. Gloria is married. To make a living, Gloria owns & operates a business venture making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from making "puto" (rice cakes) and other delicacies for sale. Gloria's husband is a farmer and maintains a rice farm. She helps by selling his harvest.

Gloria joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gloria has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Gloria is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy motorbike and motorcyle spare parts.
